Title: Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
Willkommen bei CBTW! Wir sind ein innovatives Team mit über 3.000 Mitarbeitern in 21 Ländern und führend in den Bereichen Strategie & Governance, Software-Engineering, Datenanalyse & KI und mehr.




Als Mitglied unseres Teams bei CBTW arbeitest Du in einem inspirierenden Umfeld an anspruchsvollen Projekten. Wir fördern die Entwicklung der Experten von morgen und schätzen Deine Ideen. Wenn Du bereit bist, die Zukunft der datengetriebenen Transformation mit einem hochmotivierten Team zu gestalten, bewirb Dich jetzt bei CBTW! Zusammen schaffen wir Großartiges.


Aufgaben


Deine Leidenschaft





Analyse fachlicher Anforderungen und Ableitungen analytischer Zielsetzungen für Kund:innen


Zusammenhänge komplexer Geschäftsdaten erzeugen und diese in performanten Reports visualisieren


Self-Service Datenanalysen gestalten sowie die Datenvorverarbeitung


Konsolidierung von Daten zur Ableitung angemessener Handlungsempfehlungen





Dieses Wissen bietet unseren Kund:innen echten Mehrwert. Du bist das Bindeglied zwischen IT und Business. Du konzipierst. Du realisierst. Du treibst voran.


Qualifikation


Dein Talent





Deutsch-Kenntnisse auf C1 Niveau - Beherrschung der Sprache (German Fluency is a must)


Masterabschluss, vorzugsweise in (Wirtschafts-) Informatik, Wirtschaftswissenschaften, Wirtschaftsingenieurwesen oder einer vergleichbaren Studienrichtung


Ca. 3 Jahre Erfahrung im Bereich Data Analytics


Technologieerfahrung: Tableau, Qlik, Power BI, Cognos BI, Tools wie Alteryx oder Yellowfin


Erfahrung in R Shiny, KNIME oder Visual Analytics ist von Vorteil


Reisebereitschaft innerhalb der DACH Region





Es ist unwahrscheinlich, dass jede:r Kandidat:in all diese Anforderungen erfüllt. Wenn Deine Erfahrungen anders sind und Du glaubst, dass Du einen Mehrwert für die Position bieten kannst, lass uns gerne darüber sprechen!


Benefits


Unser Versprechen




Wir bieten Dir eine Kultur, die von unseren Führungsleitsätzen angetrieben wird: unternehmerisch, ergebnisorientiert, Eigenverantwortung fördernd und sich gegenseitig zum Erfolg verhelfend. Wir schaffen Transparenz über Unternehmensziele, Zusammenarbeit und Unterstützung durch ein internationales Team auf Augenhöhe. Wir leben Austausch, Teamgeist und einen respektvollen Umgang miteinander. Das verbindet uns hierarchieübergreifend – auch im Home-Office. So erhielten wir in 2022, 2023 und 2024 die kununu Auszeichnung „TOP Company“.




Das erwartet Dich bei uns:





Onboarding: Vernetzung ab dem ersten Tag - Welcome Day, Hello Drink, Mentoring-Programm.


Entwicklung: Individuelle Förderung Deiner Stärken - Regelmäßige Feedbackgespräche, Karrierepfade, Career Committees, Online-Trainingskatalog, internationales Arbeiten mit verschiedenen Kulturen.


Work-Life-Balance: Raum für Deine Lebensplanung - Sabbatical, Remote Working aus dem Ausland, flexible Arbeitsmodelle, Elternzeitprogramme, 30 Tage Urlaub, Feiertagskalender Baden-Württemberg.


Nachhaltigkeit: Unsere Arbeit hat einen positiven Einfluss auf die Umwelt und die Gesellschaft - wir machen unsere Lösungen und Zusammenarbeit jeden Tag nachhaltiger.


Events: Fachliche und unterhaltsame Events - Summer-Tech-Event, lokale Afterworks, Sportevents, Teamevents, Weihnachtsfeiern.


Netzwerken: Verbinde Dich mit internationalen Kolleg:innen - Communities, Lunch Breaks, interne Know-How Sessions.


Fehlerkultur: Teste Dich aus und lerne aus Fehlern - Wir geben Dir Freiraum, mit neuesten Technologien zu arbeiten.


Prämien: Zahlreiche Prämien für zusätzliches Engagement.


Weitere Vorteile: Digitales Mobilitätsbudget, Corporate Benefits, Jobfahrrad, Deutschlandticket, betriebliches Gesundheitsmanagement.





Schau Dir unsere CBTW Spotify Playlist an und erhalte einen ersten musikalischen Eindruck von unserem Team: https://open.spotify.com/playlist/44kgWZRt5jmmgppH0qGszg?si=L312ch\_9SMKsCKBcN-EB\_A




Aber genug von uns, jetzt bist Du an der Reihe - Wir freuen uns darauf, Dich kennenzulernen!

Show more
HTML:
Willkommen bei CBTW! Wir sind ein innovatives Team mit über 3.000 Mitarbeitern in 21 Ländern und führend in den Bereichen Strategie & Governance, Software-Engineering, Datenanalyse & KI und mehr.


Als Mitglied unseres Teams bei CBTW arbeitest Du in einem inspirierenden Umfeld an anspruchsvollen Projekten. Wir fördern die Entwicklung der Experten von morgen und schätzen Deine Ideen. Wenn Du bereit bist, die Zukunft der datengetriebenen Transformation mit einem hochmotivierten Team zu gestalten, bewirb Dich jetzt bei CBTW! Zusammen schaffen wir Großartiges.


Aufgaben

Deine Leidenschaft



  • Analyse fachlicher Anforderungen und Ableitungen analytischer Zielsetzungen für Kund:innen

  • Zusammenhänge komplexer Geschäftsdaten erzeugen und diese in performanten Reports visualisieren

  • Self-Service Datenanalysen gestalten sowie die Datenvorverarbeitung

  • Konsolidierung von Daten zur Ableitung angemessener Handlungsempfehlungen


Dieses Wissen bietet unseren Kund:innen echten Mehrwert. Du bist das Bindeglied zwischen IT und Business. Du konzipierst. Du realisierst. Du treibst voran.


Qualifikation

Dein Talent



  • Deutsch-Kenntnisse auf C1 Niveau - Beherrschung der Sprache (German Fluency is a must)

  • Masterabschluss, vorzugsweise in (Wirtschafts-) Informatik, Wirtschaftswissenschaften, Wirtschaftsingenieurwesen oder einer vergleichbaren Studienrichtung

  • Ca. 3 Jahre Erfahrung im Bereich Data Analytics

  • Technologieerfahrung: Tableau, Qlik, Power BI, Cognos BI, Tools wie Alteryx oder Yellowfin

  • Erfahrung in R Shiny, KNIME oder Visual Analytics ist von Vorteil

  • Reisebereitschaft innerhalb der DACH Region


Es ist unwahrscheinlich, dass jede:r Kandidat:in all diese Anforderungen erfüllt. Wenn Deine Erfahrungen anders sind und Du glaubst, dass Du einen Mehrwert für die Position bieten kannst, lass uns gerne darüber sprechen!


Benefits

Unser Versprechen


Wir bieten Dir eine Kultur, die von unseren Führungsleitsätzen angetrieben wird: unternehmerisch, ergebnisorientiert, Eigenverantwortung fördernd und sich gegenseitig zum Erfolg verhelfend. Wir schaffen Transparenz über Unternehmensziele, Zusammenarbeit und Unterstützung durch ein internationales Team auf Augenhöhe. Wir leben Austausch, Teamgeist und einen respektvollen Umgang miteinander. Das verbindet uns hierarchieübergreifend – auch im Home-Office. So erhielten wir in 2022, 2023 und 2024 die kununu Auszeichnung „TOP Company“.


Das erwartet Dich bei uns:



  • Onboarding: Vernetzung ab dem ersten Tag - Welcome Day, Hello Drink, Mentoring-Programm.

  • Entwicklung: Individuelle Förderung Deiner Stärken - Regelmäßige Feedbackgespräche, Karrierepfade, Career Committees, Online-Trainingskatalog, internationales Arbeiten mit verschiedenen Kulturen.

  • Work-Life-Balance: Raum für Deine Lebensplanung - Sabbatical, Remote Working aus dem Ausland, flexible Arbeitsmodelle, Elternzeitprogramme, 30 Tage Urlaub, Feiertagskalender Baden-Württemberg.

  • Nachhaltigkeit: Unsere Arbeit hat einen positiven Einfluss auf die Umwelt und die Gesellschaft - wir machen unsere Lösungen und Zusammenarbeit jeden Tag nachhaltiger.

  • Events: Fachliche und unterhaltsame Events - Summer-Tech-Event, lokale Afterworks, Sportevents, Teamevents, Weihnachtsfeiern.

  • Netzwerken: Verbinde Dich mit internationalen Kolleg:innen - Communities, Lunch Breaks, interne Know-How Sessions.

  • Fehlerkultur: Teste Dich aus und lerne aus Fehlern - Wir geben Dir Freiraum, mit neuesten Technologien zu arbeiten.

  • Prämien: Zahlreiche Prämien für zusätzliches Engagement.

  • Weitere Vorteile: Digitales Mobilitätsbudget, Corporate Benefits, Jobfahrrad, Deutschlandticket, betriebliches Gesundheitsmanagement.

Title: Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Overview

170+ Years Strong. Industry Leader. Global Impact. At Pinkerton, the mission is to protect our clients. To do this, we provide enterprise risk management services and programs specifically designed for each client. Pinkerton employees are one of our most important assets and critical to the delivery of world-class solutions. Bonded together, we share a commitment to integrity, vigilance, and excellence.

Pinkerton is an inclusive employer who seeks candidates with diverse backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives to join our family of industry subject matter experts.

The Intelligence Analyst, assigned to one of Pinkerton’s largest global clients, will develop high-quality and timely analysis on developments, events, incidents, and trends that may impact the safety and/or security of the customer’s corporate assets in the region including civil unrest, crime, environmental hazards, and terrorism. This position's preferred location is Berlin, but London and Paris may also be considered.

Responsibilities


Represent Pinkerton’s core values of integrity, vigilance, and excellence.
Monitor, detect, analyze, and advise the client on regional adverse conditions, including civil unrest, crime, environmental hazards, and terrorism.
Plan, research, and write regular analytical reports delivering actionable insights and provide high-quality and value-driven results.
Actively monitor regional security incidents to determine potential impact and maintain an awareness of regional strategic trends.
Collect, analyze, and interpret complex data with a strong understanding and application of analytical techniques.
Conduct strategic analysis on large data sets, including metrics, physical security trends, aggregate incidents, and crime statistics.
Identify gaps in current analysis products and develop new solutions, methodologies, and products to help improve reporting, especially in data-driven analysis.
Support business continuity, crisis, and security management teams during incidents and crises.
Support colleagues if needed, including conducting peer reviews.
All other duties, as assigned.


Qualifications

Master's degree or higher with five years of professional intelligence experience in relevant sector including government and/or law enforcement.


Bi-lingual skills; English and secondary language.
Able to produce strategic intelligence reports, threat assessments, and tailored analysis.
Effective understanding of principal geopolitical risks and how they affect the private sector.
Attentive to detail and accuracy.
Able to carry out responsibilities with little supervision.
Able to collect, organize, and analyze complex data with a strong understanding and application of analytical techniques.
Serve as an effective team member.
Able to develop strong relationships within a complex environment and across multiple time zones.
Able to manage multiple projects simultaneously with competing priorities and deadlines.
Computer skills; Microsoft Office.


Working Conditions

With or without reasonable accommodation, requires the physical and mental capacity to effectively perform all essential functions;


Regular computer usage.
Occasional reaching and lifting of small objects and operating office equipment.
Frequent sitting.
May be required to occassionally work after hours.
Travel, as required.


Pinkerton is an equal opportunity employer to all applicants and positions without regard to race/ethnicity, color, national origin, ancestry, sex/gender, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, marital/prenatal status, pregnancy/childbirth or related conditions, religion, creed, age, disability, genetic information, veteran status, or any protected status by local, state, federal or country-specific law.

Title: Staff Data Analyst
Description:
About GetYourGuide

GetYourGuide is the globally leading marketplace for unforgettable travel experiences. Travelers use GetYourGuide to discover the best things to do in a destination. Since its founding in 2009, travelers from over 170 countries have booked more than 150 million tours, activities, and attraction tickets through GetYourGuide. Powered by a global team of over 700 travel experts and technologists, we are headquartered in Berlin and have 17 local offices around the world. Visit our careers website to learn more.

Team mission

The Analytics team's mission is to enable the organisation to take action based on data. We work on a variety of problems and datasets as members of cross-functional mission teams. We take ownership of the entire analytics funnel, from exploration through recommendations to impact measurement, and take pride in the insights we generate.

You Will


Develop quantitative analysis to initiate and drive business decisions focusing on supply strategy
Help the supply business and tech teams learn about their features by designing and analyzing Experiments.
Design and implement metrics, dashboards, and reports to guide the teams’ strategy and success.
Support the technical teams in tracking and producing more insightful data.
Contribute to the learning and experimentation culture of the company by promoting hypothesis-driven product and operational development and evaluation.


Who You Are


8+ years of relevant experience interpreting data in an analytics, data science or business intelligence role
Ability to collaborate with multiple teams to drive strategic decisions and execute on them
Strong project management skills
Strong knowledge of SQL and knowledge of Python
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Jupyter Notebooks)
Curiosity and reasoning skills with proven evidence of problem-solving.
Ability to understand user behavior and meaning behind the numbers
Desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction and with highly engaged individuals
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English


Nice To Have


Previous experience working with agile product teams is a plus.
Experienced with the statistics and assumptions of experimentation.
Familiarity with ETL technologies like Airflow is a plus.
Experience with big data tools (e.g. Spark, Hive) is a plus


How We Set You Up For Success


Meaningful work that helps create memorable travel experiences
A diverse, inclusive environment where your voice is valued
Collaboration with smart, engaged colleagues from over 80 nationalities
English-speaking office environment
Continuous learning opportunities through monthly Hackathons, weekly tech talks, and an annual external training budget
Mentorship programs to support your growth and career development
Flexible working arrangements to support work-life balance
Well-stocked kitchen and team-building events like our famous pizza & beer Fridays
GetYourGuide vouchers and free German lessons
Relocation assistance if needed


And more...

We look forward to hearing from you

Unlock your full potential and join our mission to create unforgettable experiences for millions around the world. If you have the skills and passion for joining our team, we invite you to apply by submitting your CV/resume in English through the form below. Check out how we hire for tips and visibility into our process and check out life at GetYourGuide. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.

We are an equal opportunity employer

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.

Title: Senior Data Analyst, Marketing Analytics
Description:
About GetYourGuide

GetYourGuide is the globally leading marketplace for unforgettable travel experiences. Travelers use GetYourGuide to discover the best things to do in a destination. Since its founding in 2009, people from all over the world have booked more than 200 million tours, activities, and attraction tickets through GetYourGuide. Powered by a global team of over 800 travel experts and technologists, we are headquartered in Berlin and have 17 local offices around the world. Visit our careers website to learn more.

Team mission

The Analytics team's mission is to enable the organisation to take action based on data. We work on a variety of problems and datasets as members of cross-functional mission teams. We take ownership of the entire analytics funnel, from exploration through recommendations to impact measurement, and take pride in the insights we generate.

This specific position is within our Marketing Analytics (Attribution & Paid Search) and will focus mostly on helping optimize our Paid Search operations and scaling our investments towards the most incremental and loyal customers. The analyst will need to intervene in our campaign setup and bidding strategies and our attribution and experimentation solutions.

You Will


Develop quantitative analysis and statistical models to evaluate and steer marketing decisions
Maintain and improve our marketing measurement tools (Attribution, experimentation framework, Customer lifetime value…)
Explore large datasets, give meaning to data and numbers, identify opportunities and issues, and present findings to stakeholders
Develop new methodologies to scale our Display and Partnerships channel, among others
Serve as a liaison between the marketing teams and the data engineering team
Mentor others in the skills needed for this role


Who You Are


5+ years of relevant experience interpreting data in an analytics, data science or business intelligence role
Strong knowledge of SQL and Python for analysis (eg, pandas, scikit-learn, pyspark)
Ability to understand user behavior and meaning behind the numbers and a track record in sharing insights to business stakeholders
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Jupyter Notebooks, Databricks)
Prior exposure to digital and performance marketing
Desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction and with highly engaged individuals
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English


Nice to have


Knowledge or previous experience of attribution and paid search.
Experience with big data tools (e.g. Spark, Hive) is a plus


How We Set You Up For Success


Meaningful work that helps create memorable travel experiences
A diverse, inclusive environment where your voice is valued
Collaboration with smart, engaged colleagues from over 80 nationalities
English-speaking office environment
Continuous learning opportunities through monthly Hackathons, weekly tech talks, and an annual external training budget
Mentorship programs to support your growth and career development
Flexible working arrangements to support work-life balance
Well-stocked kitchen and team-building events like our famous pizza & beer Fridays
GetYourGuide vouchers and free German lessons
Relocation assistance if needed


And more...

We look forward to hearing from you

Unlock your full potential and join our mission to create unforgettable experiences for millions around the world. If you have the skills and passion for joining our team, we invite you to apply by submitting your CV/resume in English through the form below. Check out how we hire for tips and visibility into our process and check out life at GetYourGuide. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.

We are an equal opportunity employer

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.

Title: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst – Central Reporting (f/m/x)
Description:
Company Description

Our goal is a solar power system on every roof, a storage unit in every house, and an e-car in every garage. How are we achieving this? Enpal makes solar easy: we rent out solar power systems, electricity storage and wallboxes at an all-inclusive rate, supplemented by a low-cost green electricity tariff, and intelligently networked into an integrated overall solution.

We are just at the beginning of our journey to becoming Europe's largest energy company. That's why we're looking for talented people to accompany us on this journey, leave their footprint and celebrate successes together with us. At Enpal, you will find a dynamic working environment as well as the space to develop yourself personally and professionally and to use your strengths effectively.

As the first green unicorn in Germany and the fastest-growing energy company in Europe (FT1000 Ranking 2022 by Financial Times & Statista), we continue to advance our mission of green energy for everyone. Be part of this success story and change the world with us!

Job Description


Strategic Partnership: Collaborate with the VP of Financial BI, VP of FP&A, and C-Suite leadership to align business intelligence strategies with financial goals. Work cross-functionally with Marketing, Sales, and Finance to deliver data-driven insights that support business growth and operational efficiency.
Project Ownership: Manage the intake and prioritization of data projects, ensuring clear goals, scope, and expected impact. Work with stakeholders to refine requirements, prioritize initiatives, and drive execution in alignment with business objectives.
End-to-End Data Solutions: Own the full lifecycle of data solutions, from scoping and MVP development to data modeling, implementation, and validation. Work closely with data engineers, analysts, and business leaders to ensure solutions are scalable and fit-for-purpose.
Data Visualization & Dashboarding: Develop effective, actionable dashboards and data products that translate complex data into clear, intuitive insights. Apply best practices in data visualization to communicate key information effectively across all levels, from operational teams to executive leadership.
Data-Driven Decision Making: Conduct ad-hoc analyses and exploratory data work to identify trends, patterns, and insights. Provide proactive recommendations that drive business performance and ensure ongoing monitoring of key metrics.
Enhancing Data Culture: Elevate analytical standards and best practices within the organization. Share knowledge, refine methodologies, and stay up to date with the latest BI, data visualization, and analytics trends.



Qualifications


5+ years of experience in business intelligence, data analytics, or a related field, with a strong understanding of customer acquisition, finance, and business performance drivers.
Technical expertise in SQL, ETL processes, and BI tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar. Our stack includes dbt, Snowflake, Streamlit, and Tableau.
Strong data visualization and dashboarding skills, with the ability to create clear, intuitive, and actionable insights from complex datasets.
Experience with Python or R for data analysis is a plus, particularly in advanced forecasting methods (e.g., econometrics, time series analysis).
Proven problem-solving skills, with experience in automating reporting workflows and leveraging data to improve decision-making.
Strong collaboration and communication skills, with the ability to engage business, analytics, and engineering teams to drive impactful solutions.
Ability to present data products and insights effectively to stakeholders at all management levels



Additional Information

At Enpal, we are proud of the diversity of our team. No decisions are made based on skin color, religion or religious belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or age, either during recruitment or employment. We strongly encourage women, neurodivergent people, people of color, and LGBTQ(+) people to apply. Enpal stands for a safe workplace and takes action against discrimination and harassment of any kind.

Title: Online Data Analyst
Description:
We are hiring freelance English and German speaking Online Data Analysts for a project aimed at improving the content and quality of digital maps, which are used by millions of users globally. The job would suit someone who is detail-oriented, likes doing research and has a good knowledge of national and local geography.

This is a freelance position on a flexible schedule - you can work in your own time whenever work is available. You will be completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment, e.g., verifying and comparing data, determining the relevance and accuracy of information. You will be provided with guidelines for each task, which need to be followed. The project offers a variety of tasks, and work is paid per task.

Requirements

Full Professional Proficiency in English and German
You must be living in Germany the last 2 consecutive years
Ability to follow guidelines and do research online using search engines, online maps and website information
You must have familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media and cultural affairs in Germany
Being open to work across a diverse set of Task Types (e.g. Maps, News, Audio tasks, Relevance)
Applicants must be 18 years or over.

Working on this project will require you to go through a standard recruitment process (including passing an open book assessment). This is a long-term project and your work will occasionally be subject to quality assurance checks.

Why Join the TELUS Digital Community?

Earn additional income with flexible hours to fit your lifestyle
Better work-life balance
Be your own boss
Complimentary Well-Being package encompassing a wealth of well-being resources.
Be part of an online community







TELUS Digital partners with a diverse and vibrant community to help our customers enhance their AI and machine learning models. The work of our AI Community contributes to improving technology and the digital experiences of many people around the world. Our AI Community works in our proprietary AI training platform handling all data types (text, images, audio, video and geo) across 500+ languages and dialects. We offer flexible work-from-home opportunities for people with passion for languages. The jobs are part-time, and there is no fixed schedule. Whoever you are, wherever you come from, come join our global AI community. https://telusdigital.com

Title: Business und Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
About

Daten. Insights. Sicherheit. – Gestalte mit uns die Zukunft von Datenmanagement & Datenschutz!

Unser Ressort Business Services mit der Abteilung Daten­management ist der Schlüssel zu fun­dierten Ent­scheidungen und einer zukunfts­sicheren Unter­nehmens­entwicklung. Hier trifft analytische Präzision auf Compliance-Exzellenz: Unsere Experten sorgen dafür, dass wir unser Wachstum gezielt steuern, Prozesse effizient gestalten und gleichzeitig höchste Daten­schutz­standards einhalten.

Ob durch die Entwicklung aussage­kräftiger Dash­boards, die Optimierung daten­basierter Prozesse oder die Sicher­stellung der Daten­schutz-Compliance – unser Team ist ein unverzicht­barer Partner für alle Entscheidungs­träger. Mit höchster Genauigkeit, nach­haltiger Dokumen­tation und eigen­verant­wortlichem Handeln gestalten sie die digitale Zukunft von B&O mit.

Bei uns findest du nicht nur einen Job, sondern eine Auf­gabe mit echter Wirkung. In einem Umfeld, das auf Ver­trauen, Eigen­verantwortung und Präzision setzt, kannst du deine Fähig­keiten voll einbringen und dich konti­nuierlich weiter­entwickeln. Werde Teil unseres Teams und gestalte mit uns die digitale und daten­schutz­konforme Zukunft des Handwerks!

Um diesen Weg konsequent weiterzugehen, suchen wir derzeit aktiv nach einem erfahrenem Business und Data Analyst (m/w/d) der unser Team in München oder Berlin ergänzt und datengetriebene Lösungen für unsere Kunden entwickelt.

TITL1_DE

Nice-to-have skills


SQL
SQL
Power BI
Berlin, Berlin, Germany


Work experience


Data Analyst
Business Intelligence


Languages


German

Title: Senior Data Analyst, Product Analytics
Description:
About GetYourGuide

GetYourGuide is the globally leading marketplace for unforgettable travel experiences. Travelers use GetYourGuide to discover the best things to do in a destination. Since its founding in 2009, travelers from over 170 countries have booked more than 200 million tours, activities, and attraction tickets through GetYourGuide. Powered by a global team of over 700 travel experts and technologists, we are headquartered in Berlin and have 17 local offices around the world. Visit our careers website to learn more.

Team Mission

The Analytics department's mission is to enable the organisation to take action based on data. We work on a variety of problems and datasets as members of cross-functional mission teams. We take ownership of the entire analytics funnel, from exploration through recommendations to impact measurement and take pride in the insights we generate.

As a Data Analyst in the Product Analytics team, you will help drive measurement, strategy, and tactical decision-making within GetYourGuide. You will solve problems that could range from understanding the relationship between review rating and conversion rate, figuring out how to measure adding videos to our product pages, what is the business value of an account login or developing a way to measure whether our customers’ on trip experience is optimal.

Responsibilities


Develop quantitative analysis to drive product decisions.
Help the Search and Discovery group to learn about their features by designing and analyzing experiments.
Design and implement data models, metrics and dashboards to guide the teams’ product strategy and success.
Support the technical teams in tracking and producing more insightful data.
Contribute to the learning and experimentation culture of the company by promoting hypothesis-driven product development and evaluation.
Answer the big questions to push our knowledge of our customers further.
Contribute to the strategic thinking of the team by being a thought partner to the Product Manager.


Requirements


5+ years of relevant experience interpreting data in an analytics, data science or business intelligence role
Excellent stakeholder management skills.
Strong knowledge of SQL and knowledge of Python
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Jupyter Notebooks)
Curiosity, reasoning skills with proven evidence of problem solving.
Ability to understand user behavior and meaning behind the numbers
Desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction and with highly engaged individuals
Ability to navigate ambiguity.
Strong customer focus with a focus on business impact.
Great communication skills


Nice To Have


Previous experience working with agile product teams is a plus.
Previous experience managing analysts is a plus.
Experienced with the statistics and assumptions of experimentation.
Familiarity with ETL technologies like Airflow is a plus.
Experience with big data tools (e.g. Spark, Hive) is a plus.
Experience with LLM APIs (OpenAI, Gemini, Anthropic) is a plus.


We Offer


Meaningful work that helps create memorable travel experiences.
The opportunity to contribute to the
A diverse, inclusive environment where your voice is valued
Collaboration with smart, engaged colleagues from over 80 nationalities
English-speaking office environment
Continuous learning opportunities through monthly Hackathons, weekly tech talks, and an annual external training budget
Mentorship programs to support your growth and career development
Flexible working arrangements to support work-life balance
Well-stocked kitchen and team-building events
GetYourGuide vouchers and free German lessons


And more…

We look forward to hearing from you

Unlock your full potential and join our mission to create unforgettable experiences for millions around the world. If you have the skills and passion for joining our team, we invite you to apply by submitting your CV/resume in English through the form below. Check out how we hire for tips and visibility into our process and check out life at GetYourGuide. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.

We are an equal opportunity employer

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst II - Hospitality Data Team
Description:
Hi there! Thanks for stopping by 👋

Are you actively looking for a new opportunity? Or just checking the market? Well… you might just be in the right place!

Lightspeed is a forward-thinking company dedicated to driving innovation in the hospitality industry through data. We leverage data insights to support strategic decisions and enhance our product offerings. As a Data Analyst 2, you will bring your expertise to an expanding team within the Hospitality unit's product department. This team acts as a strategic data partner, working closely with diverse product squads to provide expert insights and data-driven solutions that inform development decisions and optimize product performance. As a key player in shaping Lightspeed’s future, you’ll play an integral role in building actionable data expertise within our forward-looking organization.

What You'll Do


Collaborate with Cross-Functional Teams: Partner with Product Managers, Developers, Designers, and other stakeholders to understand their data needs, delivering tailored, strategic data solutions. Clearly communicate complex data insights to both technical and non-technical audiences, ensuring alignment across teams.
Lead Advanced Data Analysis: Perform and lead complex analyses, such as segmentation, customer health assessments, and impact measurements of development initiatives, guiding product direction and business decisions.
Develop Data Warehouse Solutions: Create, maintain, and test scalable data warehouse solutions using Python to ensure data integrity and reliability. Implement automated testing frameworks and leverage CI/CD pipelines to proactively identify opportunities for continuous improvement in data infrastructure.
DynamoDB Data Extraction and Visualization: Script advanced interactions with DynamoDB to extract data and develop real-time visualizations that provide critical business insights.
Dashboard and Report Development: Build, optimize, and innovate dashboards using tools like Heap and BigQuery to visualize key performance indicators (KPIs) and inform data-driven decisions.
Mentorship: Mentor and guide data analysts, fostering a collaborative, growth-oriented environment while exemplifying technical expertise and effective problem-solving.
Innovative Problem-Solving: Take ownership of complex data challenges, proactively supporting Product teams with data-driven insights that empower informed decision-making.
Generate Business Insights: Translate complex data sets into actionable business insights, helping teams understand product performance through behavioral analysis and key metrics.
Customer Data Platform Management: Optimize the data flow through platforms like Segment to ensure effective use of customer data in product development and customer success strategies.



What You'll Bring


Experience:
5+ years of professional experience using Python for data analysis, including advanced scripting and real-time data processing.
5+ years of experience with SQL, with familiarity in BigQuery and Dataform as a plus.
Experience scripting and accessing data in DynamoDB.
Technical Skills:
Python Proficiency: Expertise in data extraction, processing, and advanced analyses (Pydantic, Scikit-learn, Poetry).
SQL Proficiency: Advanced skills in SQL for querying large datasets and data manipulation.
Version Control: Experience with Git, including collaborating through commits, pull requests (PRs), and code reviews.
Data Warehousing: Strong knowledge of data warehouse development and testing using Python and SQL, with experience in cloud-based platforms such as BigQuery.
Data Visualization: Experience with real-time data visualization tools like Matplotlib, Plotly, or Dash.
As a Plus:
Experience with customer data platforms like Segment and analytics tools such as Heap.
Familiarity with AWS CLI and SDKs (e.g., Boto3 for Python) to interact with AWS.
Experience working with data warehouses, particularly Dataform or similar data transformation frameworks.
Business Acumen & Creativity: Ability to translate complex data into actionable business insights and present them effectively, with a creative approach to solving data challenges.


Collaborative Spirit

Thrive in a dynamic, cross-functional environment, working closely with various teams to meet business needs.

What’s in it for you


Lots of autonomy, flexible work culture with the option of working remotely or from one of our beautiful offices
Genuine career growth opportunities within a company that's continuously expanding
Be part of a team large enough for growth yet agile enough for real impact
Work on high-traffic products with a global user base
Opportunity to work alongside other highly skilled engineers, learn and expand your skill set, forge wonderful relationships and make your mark within the diverse and inclusive Lightspeed culture, a true Canadian tech success story



… and enjoy a range of benefits that’ll keep you happy and healthy:


Lightspeed share scheme (we are all owners).
Flexible working policy.
Mental health online platform and counseling & coaching services.
Health and wellness benefits.
LinkedIn Learning license (learning is always ongoing).
Volunteer day to be able to give back to society!



To all recruitment agencies: Lightspeed does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. If we have not directly engaged your company in writing to supply candidates for a specific vacancy, Lightspeed will not be responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Lightspeed is a proud equal opportunity employer and we are committed to creating an inclusive and barrier-free workplace. Lightspeed welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

Where to from here?

Obviously, this has to be mutually beneficial: we want you to step into a role you love, and we want to offer you a place you’re proud to come to every day. For a glimpse into our world check out our career page here.

Lightspeed is building communities through commerce, and we need people from all backgrounds and lived experiences to do that. We were founded in 2005, in Montreal’s gay village and our original members were all part of the LGBTQ+ community. The ethos of our business has been about inclusion from the very beginning, and we strive to provide a workplace where everyone belongs.

Who We Are

Powering the businesses that are the backbone of the global economy, Lightspeed's one-stop commerce platform helps merchants innovate to simplify, scale, and provide exceptional customer experiences. Our cloud commerce solution transforms and unifies online and physical operations, multichannel sales, expansion to new locations, global payments, financial solutions, and connection to supplier networks.

Founded in Montréal, Canada in 2005, Lightspeed is dual-listed on the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE: LSPD) and Toronto Stock Exchange (TSX: LSPD). With teams across North America, Europe, and Asia Pacific, the company serves retail, hospitality, and golf businesses in over 100 countries.

Lightspeed handles your information in accordance with our Applicant Privacy Statement.
Show more

    • Python Proficiency: Expertise in data extraction, processing, and advanced analyses (Pydantic, Scikit-learn, Poetry).
    • SQL Proficiency: Advanced skills in SQL for querying large datasets and data manipulation.
    • Version Control: Experience with Git, including collaborating through commits, pull requests (PRs), and code reviews.
    • Data Warehousing: Strong knowledge of data warehouse development and testing using Python and SQL, with experience in cloud-based platforms such as BigQuery.
    • Data Visualization: Experience with real-time data visualization tools like Matplotlib, Plotly, or Dash.
  • As a Plus:
    • Experience with customer data platforms like Segment and analytics tools such as Heap.
    • Familiarity with AWS CLI and SDKs (e.g., Boto3 for Python) to interact with AWS.
    • Experience working with data warehouses, particularly Dataform or similar data transformation frameworks.
  • Business Acumen & Creativity: Ability to translate complex data into actionable business insights and present them effectively, with a creative approach to solving data challenges.

Collaborative Spirit

Thrive in a dynamic, cross-functional environment, working closely with various teams to meet business needs.

What’s in it for you

  • Lots of autonomy, flexible work culture with the option of working remotely or from one of our beautiful offices
  • Genuine career growth opportunities within a company that's continuously expanding
  • Be part of a team large enough for growth yet agile enough for real impact
  • Work on high-traffic products with a global user base
  • Opportunity to work alongside other highly skilled engineers, learn and expand your skill set, forge wonderful relationships and make your mark within the diverse and inclusive Lightspeed culture, a true Canadian tech success story


… and enjoy a range of benefits that’ll keep you happy and healthy:

  • Lightspeed share scheme (we are all owners).
  • Flexible working policy.
  • Mental health online platform and counseling & coaching services.
  • Health and wellness benefits.
  • LinkedIn Learning license (learning is always ongoing).
  • Volunteer day to be able to give back to society!


To all recruitment agencies: Lightspeed does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. If we have not directly engaged your company in writing to supply candidates for a specific vacancy, Lightspeed will not be responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Lightspeed is a proud equal opportunity employer and we are committed to creating an inclusive and barrier-free workplace. Lightspeed welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

Where to from here?

Obviously, this has to be mutually beneficial: we want you to step into a role you love, and we want to offer you a place you’re proud to come to every day. For a glimpse into our world check out our career page here.

Lightspeed is building communities through commerce, and we need people from all backgrounds and lived experiences to do that. We were founded in 2005, in Montreal’s gay village and our original members were all part of the LGBTQ+ community. The ethos of our business has been about inclusion from the very beginning, and we strive to provide a workplace where everyone belongs.

Who We Are

Powering the businesses that are the backbone of the global economy, Lightspeed's one-stop commerce platform helps merchants innovate to simplify, scale, and provide exceptional customer experiences. Our cloud commerce solution transforms and unifies online and physical operations, multichannel sales, expansion to new locations, global payments, financial solutions, and connection to supplier networks.

Founded in Montréal, Canada in 2005, Lightspeed is dual-listed on the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE: LSPD) and Toronto Stock Exchange (TSX: LSPD). With teams across North America, Europe, and Asia Pacific, the company serves retail, hospitality, and golf businesses in over 100 countries.

Lightspeed handles your information in accordance with our Applicant Privacy Statement.

Title: Datenanalyst:in
Description:
Mach Daten zur Entscheidungsgrundlage.




DINA entwickelt Technologien für funktionale und Cybersicherheit in Maschinen. Unsere Lösungen sorgen dafür, dass industrielle Systeme zuverlässig, sicher und zukunftsfähig bleiben.

Wir setzen auf datengetriebene Entscheidungen – aber da geht noch mehr. Mit deiner Expertise als Data Analyst (w/m/x) bringst du Struktur in unsere Kundendaten, entwickelst aussagekräftige Analysen und sorgst dafür, dass Daten zum integralen Bestandteil unserer Geschäftsstrategie werden.




Wir arbeiten in einer Holokratie – das bedeutet: keine starren Hierarchien, keine langen Entscheidungswege, sondern Verantwortung von Tag eins an. Wenn du gestalten willst, statt nur zu verwalten, bist du hier richtig.







Deine Aufgaben




Customer Journey Analytics: Du analysierst die gesamte Customer Journey – von Marketing über Sales bis zu Customer Success – und leitest daraus klare Handlungsempfehlungen ab.
Dashboards & Reporting: Du entwickelst Dashboards für Umsatzprognosen, Deal-Pipelines, Marketing-Performance und Kundenzufriedenheit.
Revenue Operations (RevOps): Deine Analysen helfen dabei, Prozesse zu optimieren und datenbasierte Geschäftsentscheidungen zu treffen.
Datenintegration & Engineering: Du optimierst die Anbindung und Nutzung unserer Daten aus CRM (HubSpot) und ERP (SAP Business One).
Preis- & Rabattanalysen: Du erkennst Muster, analysierst Rabattstrukturen und hilfst, die Preisstrategie zu optimieren.
Zukunftsperspektive: Du treibst das Thema Daten in der Organisation voran und hast die Möglichkeit, unser Data-Team mit aufzubauen.







Dein Profil




Analytische Stärke & Business-Sinn – Du verstehst, welche Zahlen wirklich relevant sind und wie man sie sinnvoll nutzt.
Kommerzielles Gespür – Du erkennst, welche datenbasierten Entscheidungen direkten Einfluss auf das Geschäft haben.
Visualisierung – Du bereitest Daten so auf, dass sie sofort verständlich und einprägsam sind.
Storytelling mit Daten – Du kannst aus Zahlen eine klare, überzeugende Geschichte machen, die Entscheidungen vorantreibt.
Eigenverantwortung & Proaktivität – Du wartest nicht auf Aufgaben, sondern siehst, was getan werden muss – und setzt es um.
Erfahrung in der Datenanalyse – 3-5 Jahre Erfahrung mit SQL, idealerweise ergänzt durch Tableau, Power BI oder Looker.
Technisches Verständnis – Du kannst mit APIs umgehen und hast Grundkenntnisse in der Datenintegration.
Kommunikation auf Augenhöhe – Du kannst mit Sales, Marketing und Management sprechen – und bringst deine Analysen auf den Punkt.







Das bekommst du von uns




Täglicher Team-Lunch – Dein Mittagessen geht auf uns.
Firmenfitness – Zugang zu Gympass, Wellpass oder Urban Sports.
Weiterbildung & Coaching – Dein Budget für Schulungen & Konferenzen.
Ausstattung nach Wahl – Laptop, Monitor & Headset nach deinen Bedürfnissen.
Mehr Eigenverantwortung – Entscheidungen treffen, statt auf Vorgaben warten.
Klare Rollen & Transparenz – Jeder weiß, wer wofür verantwortlich ist.
Gestaltungsspielraum – Deine Ideen bewegen etwas – in Prozessen, Strategie & Technologie.
Interdisziplinäre Zusammenarbeit – Arbeiten in Kreisen, nicht in Abteilungen.
Betriebliche Altersvorsorge – 40 € VWL + 25 € Zuschuss von uns.
Team-Workshops & Offsites – Zweimal im Jahr gemeinsame Strategie & Weiterentwicklung.
Flexibel & agil – Deine Rolle wächst mit dir, nicht umgekehrt.




Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
🌈 WE AT FRIENDSURANCE




We believe that dealing with insurance should bring a smile to your face. We build the most intuitive B2B2C SaaS platform, making insurance all about the customer.

As a deeply engaged and capable Senior Data Analyst (m/f/d), you thrive on shaping a strong data culture and building insights-driven solutions that empower those around you.

You act as a key interface between business and data, translating complex information into clear, impactful decisions. In this role, you’ll engage in cross-functional collaboration, reporting, and the development of data products while contributing to strategic company initiatives.




✅ YOUR TASKS & RESPONSIBILITIES




Shape and define the information goals of the business and stakeholders.
Deliver the right reports, analyses, and data solutions using the most suitable tools and technologies for each task.
Identify and integrate useful data sources, collaborating with Data Engineers and stakeholders to build sustainable, end-to-end analytics solutions.
Co-own and evolve data models and business data structures to ensure consistency, scalability, and alignment with business needs.
Lead and support legacy data migrations, ensuring data integrity, efficiency, and seamless integration into modern systems.
Optimize and improve the analytics tech stack, continuously enhancing data processes and tooling.
Work closely with stakeholders to refine requirements and improve how data-driven priorities are set.
Shape the company's Data Strategy alongside the data team and company leadership.
Champion and contribute to a strong data culture across the organization.
Provide expert guidance and support, helping stakeholders obtain the insights they need to make decisions and track success.




🎯 YOU WILL CREATE IMPACT BY




Providing reliable and coherent business data to stakeholders in management and large B2B partners
Creating continuously improving self-service analytics solutions
Building up our data-models and domain-understanding across all company functions
Shape and deliver strategic projects around Data that create direct value




By the way - You don’t need to check all the boxes. We want to meet YOU!




👻 YOUR PROFILE




5+ years of experience in business intelligence and data analytics, delivering insights and reports that drive decision-making.
Proven track record of building insightful reports and conducting in-depth analysis using established reporting tools, preferably Tableau.
Strong SQL expertise with relational databases, especially PostgreSQL, as well as ANSI SQL/Snowflake. Bonus points for query optimization, big-data querying, and columnar storage experience.
Ability to architect and structure reporting and analytics frameworks in a systematic, reusable, and scalable way.
Excellent communication skills, enabling you to effectively convey insights to stakeholders and collaborate with technical and non-technical team members.
Experience with and affinity for Domain-Driven Design (DDD), and other data modeling fundamentals.
Self-sufficient in adopting new technologies and integrating diverse data sources, continuously expanding your analytics capabilities.
Knowledge of common third-party data sources and analytical tools, such as Google Analytics.
Bonus points for experience in adjacent fields like Data Science and Data Engineering (especially Python but also MATLAB, R, Machine Learning, MapReduce, etc.).
A highly professional, curious, proactive, and supportive mindset, driving collaboration and innovation.
Experience working successfully with colleagues from diverse cultural backgrounds.
Fluent in English (C1 or higher) is a must; German is a plus.




🫂 WE AS A TEAM




We are a tight-knit group in a founder-owned “grown-up” startup. We love what we do and what we build and we care about our amazing team. We value each team member and develop their unique talents.




At Friendsurance, we believe that today's social structures disproportionately disadvantage people from marginalized populations - including people of color, people with disabilities, working-class people, single parents, women, and members of LGBTQIA+ communities. We also believe that these groups need to be actively included in the workforce. Therefore, we strongly encourage people with these identities or members of other marginalized communities to apply. We do not require a photo or information about your gender/sex or marital status for our application process.




🤝 OUR OFFER




100% Remote in Germany, on-site in Berlin, or a mix as you wish
Flexible and family-friendly working hours
A big and lovely designed office in Berlin-Kreuzberg with quiet working conditions, plenty of meeting rooms, and your typical startup amenities
A generous personal development budget for all employees
Legendary team events and parties
Language classes
Urban Sports membership subsidy
Unlimited mental health support through OpenUp
A unique and international team
A people-focused management
And much more!




Sounds interesting? We are very much looking forward to your application ❤️

Show more

Title: Working Student - Data Science (20h/week)
Description:
Location: Berlin, Germany

Contract Type: Part-time (up to 20h/week), Working Student




Help build the data infrastructure powering tomorrow’s climate solutions.




At Everest Carbon, we’re developing groundbreaking sensors that measure how much CO₂ is removed from the atmosphere through Enhanced Weathering — a scalable, natural solution to the climate crisis. Our sensors are already being used in the field, and demand is growing fast. We’re looking for a hands-on Data Science Working Student to help us analyze large volumes of sensor data and develop machine learning models to improve sensor calibration and field performance.




You'll join our R&D team at an exciting moment: scaling a breakthrough technology from 1 to 100. This is not just a typical data cleaning job — it's a technical, dynamic role where you'll explore real-world sensor data, build predictive models, validate algorithms, and help design the data pipelines that will scale our technology globally.


Tasks



Analyze large, real-world sensor datasets from field deployments


Develop and validate machine learning models to improve sensor calibration and data interpretation


Build and maintain data pipelines and workflows for sensor data processing


Support the design of algorithms for real-time sensor monitoring and diagnostics


Perform exploratory data analysis (EDA) to identify patterns, anomalies, and improvement opportunities


Collaborate closely with R&D engineers to translate raw data into actionable insights


Document your work clearly for internal use and future scaling



Requirements



You are enrolled in a Bachelor’s or Master’s program in Physics, Mathematics, Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering or a related field


Strong experience with Python (including libraries like pandas, scikit-learn, NumPy, matplotlib)


Solid understanding of data analysis, statistics, and machine learning fundamentals


First experience with real-world, noisy datasets (e.g., from sensors, lab experiments, or research projects)


Familiarity with basic software engineering practices (e.g., Git, version control, writing clean code)


Hands-on mentality: you enjoy solving technical challenges, even when data is messy


(Bonus) Experience with time-series data, signal processing, or calibration models


(Bonus) Familiarity with cloud tools (e.g., AWS, GCP) or database management (e.g., SQL, InfluxDB)



Benefits



Mission-driven work: your work will directly contribute to building climate solutions based on real, measurable impact


Hands-on learning: work directly with our Head of R&D and CEO, gaining first-hand experience in next-generation data science methods, real-world sensor analytics, and leveraging large language models (LLMs) in practice to 10x your data science work


Growth opportunity: as we scale, you’ll have the chance to take on more responsibility or specialize in areas like machine learning, data engineering, or scientific computing


Startup vibe, real impact: small, collaborative team, flat hierarchy, and the opportunity to see your work go into production quickly


Benefits: paid vacation, healthcare, retirement plan, free snacks & good coffee, and a beautiful Berlin office with lab and workshop space





We Would Love to Hear From You




We understand that you might not fit all of the requirements above perfectly. We envision our team to be as diverse as the solutions that will solve the climate crisis. Forming a compassionate workplace is a core part of our culture – including all walks of life, experiences, and perspectives. Candidates from structurally underrepresented cultures and backgrounds are especially encouraged to apply.




Apply Now




If you're ready to leverage your extensive experience to make a substantial impact on climate change, apply today!

Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst, Growth Analytics
Description:
About GetYourGuide

GetYourGuide is the globally leading marketplace for unforgettable travel experiences. Travelers use GetYourGuide to discover the best things to do in a destination. Since its founding in 2009, travelers from over 170 countries have booked more than 200 million tours, activities, and attraction tickets through GetYourGuide. Powered by a global team of over 700 travel experts and technologists, we are headquartered in Berlin and have 17 local offices around the world. Visit our careers website to learn more.

Team mission

The Analytics department's mission is to enable the organisation to take action based on data. We work on a variety of problems and datasets as members of cross-functional mission teams. We take ownership of the entire analytics funnel, from exploration through recommendations to impact measurement and take pride in the insights we generate.

This Organic Growth Analytics team works with marketeers, analysts, product managers, data scientists and engineers to create and promote a best-in-class marketplace product. You will also collaborate closely with the Marketing Analytics team that focuses on paid acquisition channels to create an aligned holistic view. Your team will build an understanding of how to utilise our organic growth channels to the maximum capacity, and support the teams to reach their targets via operational and strategic insights, identifying opportunities and enabling proper measurement.

You Will


Develop quantitative analysis to drive product and marketing decisions.
In collaboration with stakeholders identify organic growth opportunities and dependencies.
Collaborate with marketing analytics and Growth cluster leads to develop a comprehensive understanding of user acquisition and retention channels.
Design and implement data models, metrics and dashboards to guide the teams strategy and success.
Support the technical teams in tracking and producing more insightful data.
Contribute to the learning and experimentation culture of the company by promoting hypothesis-driven development and evaluation.
Answer the big questions to push our knowledge of our customers further.
Contribute to the strategic thinking of the team by being a thought partner to the Product Managers and Marketing Leads.


Who You Are


5+ years of relevant experience interpreting data in an analytics, data science or business intelligence role
Excellent stakeholder management
Strong knowledge of SQL and experience with statistical packages (e.g. R, Python)
Strong statistical background and proficiency with advanced statistical methods
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Jupyter Notebooks)
Ability to understand user behavior and meaning behind the numbers, and translate them into actionable insights
Desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction in ambiguous situations and with highly engaged individuals
Strong customer-centric mindset with a focus on business impact
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English


Nice To Have


Experience in SEO and CRM analytics, and with growth data products is of significant benefit.
Familiarity with ETL technologies like Airflow is a plus.
Experience with big data tools (e.g. Spark, Hive) is a plus.
Experience with LLM APIs (OpenAI, Gemini, Anthropic) is a plus.


How We Set You Up For Success


Meaningful work that helps create memorable travel experiences
A diverse, inclusive environment where your voice is valued
Collaboration with smart, engaged colleagues from over 80 nationalities
English-speaking office environment
Continuous learning opportunities through monthly Hackathons, weekly tech talks, and an annual external training budget
Mentorship programs to support your growth and career development
Flexible working arrangements to support work-life balance
GetYourGuide vouchers and free German lessons
Relocation assistance if needed


And more...

We look forward to hearing from you

Unlock your full potential and join our mission to create unforgettable experiences for millions around the world. If you have the skills and passion for joining our team, we invite you to apply by submitting your CV/resume in English through the form below. Check out how we hire for tips and visibility into our process and check out life at GetYourGuide. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.

We are an equal opportunity employer

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.


Show more
HTML:
About GetYourGuide

GetYourGuide is the globally leading marketplace for unforgettable travel experiences. Travelers use GetYourGuide to discover the best things to do in a destination. Since its founding in 2009, travelers from over 170 countries have booked more than 200 million tours, activities, and attraction tickets through GetYourGuide. Powered by a global team of over 700 travel experts and technologists, we are headquartered in Berlin and have 17 local offices around the world. Visit our careers website to learn more.

Team mission

The Analytics department's mission is to enable the organisation to take action based on data. We work on a variety of problems and datasets as members of cross-functional mission teams. We take ownership of the entire analytics funnel, from exploration through recommendations to impact measurement and take pride in the insights we generate.

This Organic Growth Analytics team works with marketeers, analysts, product managers, data scientists and engineers to create and promote a best-in-class marketplace product. You will also collaborate closely with the Marketing Analytics team that focuses on paid acquisition channels to create an aligned holistic view. Your team will build an understanding of how to utilise our organic growth channels to the maximum capacity, and support the teams to reach their targets via operational and strategic insights, identifying opportunities and enabling proper measurement.

You Will

  • Develop quantitative analysis to drive product and marketing decisions.
  • In collaboration with stakeholders identify organic growth opportunities and dependencies.
  • Collaborate with marketing analytics and Growth cluster leads to develop a comprehensive understanding of user acquisition and retention channels.
  • Design and implement data models, metrics and dashboards to guide the teams strategy and success.
  • Support the technical teams in tracking and producing more insightful data.
  • Contribute to the learning and experimentation culture of the company by promoting hypothesis-driven development and evaluation.
  • Answer the big questions to push our knowledge of our customers further.
  • Contribute to the strategic thinking of the team by being a thought partner to the Product Managers and Marketing Leads.

Who You Are

  • 5+ years of relevant experience interpreting data in an analytics, data science or business intelligence role
  • Excellent stakeholder management
  • Strong knowledge of SQL and experience with statistical packages (e.g. R, Python)
  • Strong statistical background and proficiency with advanced statistical methods
  • Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Jupyter Notebooks)
  • Ability to understand user behavior and meaning behind the numbers, and translate them into actionable insights
  • Desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction in ambiguous situations and with highly engaged individuals
  • Strong customer-centric mindset with a focus on business impact
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English

Nice To Have

  • Experience in SEO and CRM analytics, and with growth data products is of significant benefit.
  • Familiarity with ETL technologies like Airflow is a plus.
  • Experience with big data tools (e.g. Spark, Hive) is a plus.
  • Experience with LLM APIs (OpenAI, Gemini, Anthropic) is a plus.

How We Set You Up For Success

  • Meaningful work that helps create memorable travel experiences
  • A diverse, inclusive environment where your voice is valued
  • Collaboration with smart, engaged colleagues from over 80 nationalities
  • English-speaking office environment
  • Continuous learning opportunities through monthly Hackathons, weekly tech talks, and an annual external training budget
  • Mentorship programs to support your growth and career development
  • Flexible working arrangements to support work-life balance
  • GetYourGuide vouchers and free German lessons
  • Relocation assistance if needed

And more...

We look forward to hearing from you

Unlock your full potential and join our mission to create unforgettable experiences for millions around the world. If you have the skills and passion for joining our team, we invite you to apply by submitting your CV/resume in English through the form below. Check out how we hire for tips and visibility into our process and check out life at GetYourGuide. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.

We are an equal opportunity employer

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.

Title: Staff Product Analyst, Adtech
Description:
About The Opportunity

We are on the lookout for a Staff Product Analyst to join the Adtech tribe on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.

We work on developing digital advertising solutions for our vendors. Currently, these solutions are available on our food ordering platform, both on mobile and the web. The Ad Tech solutions support the vendors in all three steps of the marketing funnel: awareness, consideration, and conversion enabling them to achieve sustainable growth on our platform.

A Product Analyst in the Ad Tech organization plays a pivotal role in enabling data-driven decision-making. You will have end-to-end ownership of data: define and implement tracking requirements, set up A/B tests, analyze large datasets to provide actionable insights on the performance of different revenue streams, and communicate the results to relevant stakeholders.

You will be a critical member in defining the product strategy and the continued success of our brands.

If you're a creative problem solver who is hungry for a new adventure, an international workplace is waiting for you in the heart of Berlin!


Drive data mindset in the team, guide in terms of methodology, support and execute testing, and be a quality gatekeeper on data leading to product decisions
Develop in-depth analytical understanding for what drives growth for the product and how it can be improved
Leverage insights from data by providing analyses, reports and dashboards for product management and other departments
Use quantitative analysis and the presentation of data to see beyond the numbers and understand what drives our business, providing insights to help product managers, designers, and engineers to decide which features to build and why
Work with structured and semi-structured data from different data sources and different products


What you need to be successful


Overall 5+ years of experience, preferably in e-commerce
You've completed a degree in statistics, mathematics, economics, computer science or an equivalent education or possess relevant practical experience
Very good communication skills in English, both written and oral
Data Analysis: Strong experience in SQL (BigQuery) and Python (alternatively R)
A/B Testing: Experience designing experiments and analyzing results with a solid background in statistics
Data Visualization Technologies: Preferably Tableau or similar alternatives e.g. Looker, QlikView, etc.


Nice to have:


Tracking Technologies: Google Analytics or similar alternatives e.g. Adobe Analytics/Omniture, SnowPlow, etc.
Industry expertise in advertising and/or marketing.


Who we are

As the world’s pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe’s largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

What's in it for you

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you’re in good shape, then we’re in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
We will support you in developing yourself and your career growth opportunities: 1.000 € Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses.
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we’ll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts. Courses.


Ready to join our team? If you’re excited to grow, collaborate and be part of the world’s leading delivery platform, we’d love to hear from you. Apply today!

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience—just include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst - Paid Marketing Optimization | With relocation to Barcelona, Spain
Description:
We power people’s progress.

At Preply, we’re all about creating life-changing learning experiences. We help people discover the magic of the perfect tutor, craft a personalized learning journey, and stay motivated to keep growing. Our approach is human-led, tech-enabled - and it’s creating real impact. So far, 90,000 tutors have delivered over 20 million lessons to learners in more than 175 countries. Every Preply lesson sparks change, fuels ambition, and drives progress that matters.




Meet the team!

At Preply, we're growing a talented Data Team to empower top-notch decision-making across our organization. Our team collaborates closely with various other chapters - including product, business, and platform - leveraging analysis, experimentation, causal inference, and machine learning.




You’ll be embedded in cross-functional teams, partnering with our MarTech Product Manager, Marketeers, Tech Leads, and the Data Strategy team. Check out our Tech Radar to see the tools and technologies we love using at Preply!




What You’ll Be Doing

Own and design Preply’s marketing performance dashboard in Looker, ensuring it serves as the single source of truth for decision-making
Build a dashboard experience that supports the budget steering process, weaving together insights from multiple measurement frameworks (e.g., MMM, attribution, incrementality) even when those insights are conflicting
Make sense of marketing measurement outputs provided by the Data Science team and help stakeholders interpret trade-offs across channels
Set up and lead weekly steering meetings with stakeholders to align on findings, identify gaps, and make data-informed budget and strategy decisions
Leverage SQL and LookML to build custom data models and explorers for self-serve analytics
Collaborate closely with channel owners and data scientists to drive performance and clarity in reporting




What You Need To Succeed

Previous experience in paid marketing analytics, ideally with MMM, attribution or incrementality testing.
Comfort working with ambiguous data, and ability to guide stakeholders through uncertainty with clear recommendations
Strong proficiency in SQL
Experience with Looker, including hands-on use of LookML to build and maintain dashboards and data models
Experience in environments with cross-device user behavior (web and app), and understanding of tracking complexities across platforms
Excellent communication and storytelling skills, able to distill complex analyses into simple, impactful narratives




Nice To Have

Experience with SKAN (StoreKit Ad Network) and privacy-preserving attribution methods on iOS
Familiarity with experimentation platforms, uplift modeling, or Bayesian methods




Why You’ll Love It At Preply

An open, collaborative, dynamic and diverse culture;
A generous monthly allowance for lessons on Preply.com, Learning & Development budget and time off for your self-development;
A competitive financial package with equity, leave allowance and health insurance;
Not in Barcelona? We offer an attractive relocation package to join us in our Preply Barcelona Hub;
Access to free mental health support platforms;
Access to Gympass-partnered wellness and gym centers throughout Spain to promote and support well-being and physical health;
The opportunity to unlock the potential of learners and tutors through language learning and teaching in 175 countries (and counting!).




Our Principles

Care to change the world - We are passionate about our work and care deeply about its impact to be life changing.
We do it for learners - For both Preply and tutors, learners are why we do what we do. Every day we focus on empowering tutors to deliver an exceptional learning experience.
Keep perfecting - To create an outstanding customer experience, we focus on simplicity, smoothness, and enjoyment, continually perfecting it as every detail matters.
Now is the time - In a fast-paced world, it matters how quickly we act. Now is the time to make great things happen.
Disciplined execution - What makes us disciplined is the excellence in our execution. We set clear goals, focus on what matters, and utilize our resources efficiently.
Dive deep - We leverage business acumen and curiosity to investigate disparities between numbers and stories, unlocking meaningful insights to guide our decisions.
Growth mindset - We proactively seek growth opportunities and believe today's best performance becomes tomorrow's starting point. We humbly embrace feedback and learn from setbacks.
Raise the bar - We raise our performance standards continuously, alongside each new hire and promotion. We build diverse and high-performing teams that can make a real difference.
Challenge, disagree and commit - We value open and candid communication, even when we don’t fully agree. We speak our minds, challenge when necessary, and fully commit to decisions once made.
One Preply - We prioritize collaboration, inclusion, and the success of our team over personal ambitions. Together, we support and celebrate each other's progress.




Diversity, Equity, And Inclusion

Preply is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment where people from all backgrounds can thrive. Different opinions and viewpoints are key ingredients in our success as a multicultural Ed-Tech company.

Preply will consider all applications for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age or veteran status. Together, we are The World Class.

Show more
