Title: Data Analyst, Operations and HSSE
Description:
POSITION DESCRIPTION – DATA ANALYST, OPERATIONS & HSSE




POSITION OVERVIEW

Reports to: Head of Operational Analytics

Location: Vancouver




POSITION SUMMARY




The Data Analyst, Operations and HSSE (Health, Safety, Sustainability and Environment) plays a critical role in supporting health and safety, sustainability, and operational reporting across a global portfolio at Eldorado Gold. This position is responsible for collecting, analyzing, and visualizing data to drive informed decision-making and continuous improvement in site performance. The analyst ensures the timely and accurate consolidation of daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly, and annual reports, integrating data from multiple sites and operational systems. The Analyst will collaborate with site teams and corporate functions to enhance operational and HSSE data generation, validation, tracking and reporting.




KEY RESPONSIBILITIES




Data Visualization & Business Intelligence

Design and maintain interactive dashboards and reports using Power BI or similar tools to enhance decision-making and planning.
Integrate operational software insights into dashboards to improve operational visibility and forecasting.
Create clear, user-friendly data visualizations to communicate complex operational, health & safety, and sustainability trends.
Continuously enhance data visualization techniques to improve data accessibility insights for sites and corporate teams.




Operational Performance & Reporting




Support the completion and maintain updated key operational and HSSE data processes mapping.
Consolidate operational data from multiple mine sites for daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly, and annual performance reports.
Utilize AVEVA and Pi data historian to collect, process, and analyze real-time mining and processing data.
Automate reporting processes to enhance data accuracy, efficiency, and transparency across sites.
Work closely with operations and technical services teams to improve data collection, standardization, and reporting methodologies.
Provide ad hoc analysis on production, mining and processing efficiency, energy usage, and other key performance areas.
Support the broader Operational Support and Technical Services team on data related projects including such activities as daily and monthly operational reports, business planning, production forecasting and continuous improvement projects.
Support quality assurance and quality control activities to ensure the integrity of the data being collected and analyzed.




Health & Safety and Sustainability Reporting




Collect and validate health, safety and sustainability data from various sources to provide consolidated reporting.
Support the implementation of our global HSSE data platform.
Act as a “super user” of our global HSSE data platform to support sites implementation.
Maintain in-depth knowledge of our global HSSE data platform and oversee the integrity, accuracy and security of the data within the platform.
Identify and implement improvements to data management processes within HSSE.
Monitor key health, safety, and environmental KPIs, identifying trends and providing actionable insights to site teams and corporate leadership.
Support incident tracking, risk analysis, and environmental compliance reporting, leveraging automation where possible.




VALUES

Collaboration – We succeed together
Integrity – We are honest and do the right thing
Agility – We continuously assess, adapt and navigate to find solutions
Courage – We embrace the unknown and face challenges head-on
Drive – We persevere through adversity, remaining committed to delivering on our promises




QUALIFICATIONS, KNOWLEDGE & PREVIOUS EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS




Bachelor’s degree in Data Analytics, Business Intelligence, Mining Engineering, Environmental Science, or a related field.
5+ years of general industry experience preferably in mining, natural resources, or heavy industries and 3+ years of experience in a data analysis, reporting, or business intelligence role.
Strong proficiency in Excel, SQL, Power BI, Tableau, and other data visualization tools.
Experience using AVEVA and Pi data historians for real-time operational data collection and analysis is strongly preferred
Understanding of mining operations, processing plants, etc. is a strong asset.
Knowledge of Extract, Transform, Load (ETL) processes, automation tools, and database management is an advantage.
Ability to work with large, complex datasets while ensuring data integrity and compliance with industry standards.
Strong communication and stakeholder engagement skills, with the ability to present technical data to non-technical audiences.
Collaborative team player with the ability to work effectively across departments and locations.
International travel to project sites and regional offices required up to 10–15% of the time, as needed.

Title: Advanced Data Analyst, UGX
Description:
Description & Requirements

Electronic Arts creates next-level entertainment experiences that inspire players and fans around the world. Here, everyone is part of the story. Part of a community that connects across the globe. A place where creativity thrives, new perspectives are invited, and ideas matter. A team where everyone makes play happen.

We are looking for a dedicated Advanced Data Analyst to join our UGX and Player Safety team. Reporting to the Senior Manager of Analytics, you will play an important part in meeting the increasing demand for data-driven insights that shape our decision-making processes. Working within an exciting and cross-functional environment, you will collaborate with several teams to deepen engagement and improve retention of our players.

You will foster relationships and collaborate with several data professionals across the organization and be challenged by complex data systems. Your responsibilities may span diverse projects across UGX, with a focus on improving the UGC search experience through advanced analytics.

Hybrid or remote work available. Preferably in Vancouver but open to all of Canada.

Responsibilities


Partner with Product Managers to analyze the impact of products and solutions within the game and provide applicable recommendations to affect future iterations.
Craft KPIs to guide the success strategy for user generated content search experience in game.
Analyze performance and effect of ML models on player experience to influence data scientists on future iterations.
Profile, clean and analyze data through SQL, R/Python and other database technologies.
Identify data quality issues, assess downstream impact and propose practical solutions.
Partner with data engineers, architects and QV to develop ETLs and stored procedures.


Qualifications


A degree in a quantitative discipline (Statistics, Data Science, Business, Mathematics, Economics)
5+ years of experience doing complex quantitative analysis to help guide decisions, in a consumer products-oriented industry (e.g. gaming, entertainment, e-commerce)
Advanced knowledge in SQL and relational databases with proficiency analyzing large datasets in programmatic analysis tools (e.g. Python, R)
Advanced in dashboard development (i.e. Looker, Tableau, PowerBI)
Experienced with experimental design and applied statistics
Practical experience with statistical models
Direct experience working with user generated content or search solutions preferred


Compensation And Benefits

The ranges listed below are what EA in good faith expects to pay applicants for this role in these locations at the time of this posting. If you reside in a different location, a recruiter will advise on the applicable range and benefits. Pay offered will be determined based on a number of relevant business and candidate factors (e.g. education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, geographic location, or business needs).

PAY RANGES


British Columbia (depending on location e.g. Vancouver vs. Victoria) * $107,600 - $147,100 CAD


In British Columbia, we offer a package of benefits including vacation (3 weeks per year to start), 10 days per year of sick time, paid top-up to EI/QPIP benefits up to 100% of base salary when you welcome a new child (12 weeks for maternity, and 4 weeks for parental/adoption leave), extended health/dental/vision coverage, life insurance, disability insurance, retirement plan to regular full-time employees. Certain roles may also be eligible for bonus and equity.

About Electronic Arts

We’re proud to have an extensive portfolio of games and experiences, locations around the world, and opportunities across EA. We value adaptability, resilience, creativity, and curiosity. From leadership that brings out your potential, to creating space for learning and experimenting, we empower you to do great work and pursue opportunities for growth.

We take a holistic approach with our benefits program, focusing on physical, emotional, financial, career, and community wellness to support a balanced life with paid time off and new parent leave, plus free games and so much more. We nurture environments where our teams can always bring their best to what they do.

Electronic Arts is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We will also consider employment qualified applicants with criminal records in accordance with applicable law. EA also makes workplace accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities as required by applicable law.

Title: Insights Analyst
Description:
Senior Insights Analyst, Fit Excellence

12-month Contract with opportunity to extend

Hybrid(4 onsite days per week)

Vancouver, B.C.




About the team

The Product Insight team is the intersection of product design and supply chain technology for our top retail client. This group has a strong focus on data and analytics with a goal to improve product sustainability and customer experience. This group gives leadership insight to further create incredible products and experiences for their customers world wide.




Day in the Life

Supports end to end strategy and delivery for lululemon's Product Voice of Guest program specific to guest fit/sizing capturing feedback across all internal and external channels and creating valuable insights to inform all areas of the business
Produce executive-level reporting gleaning insights and telling a compelling post-launch product story through data that fits the audience
Conduct research and performs various analyses to drive data-driven insights for Fit Excellence
Bring analytics/BI best practices for reporting and data infrastructure for Global Quality
Provide input to Fit and Sizing stakeholders in process improvement sessions around analyzing guest insights through quantitative, qualitative, and statistical methods, including but not limited to defining the tools or engineering solutions needed to improve reporting efficiency and effectiveness




Qualifications:

5+ years expert level in telling a compelling story with powerful insights based on analyzed large quantities of qualitative and quantitative data
10+ years of data analytics, data modelling, and reporting, preferable in a retail or supply chain environment
Expert-level proficiency in Excel, Power BI, SQL, database management, data modeling, and database structures; experience with Smartsheet and SSRS/PBI Report Builder
Excellent communication, spelling and grammatical attention to detail both written and verbal with external and internal stakeholders across all levels










Eight Eleven Group (Brooksource) provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, citizenship, disability, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, amnesty, or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state, and local laws.

Title: Senior Data Analyst, Digital
Description:
THE TEAM

The mission of the Analytics Department is to provide the business with actionable and accurate information to enable data-driven decision-making.




THE OPPORTUNITY

As a member of the Data & Analytics Department you will be part of the team that bridges the gap between business strategy and data to drive client acquisition, activation, retention and reactivation. As the Data Analyst, you will combine your deep understanding of who our clients are, with your passion for data and masterful analytics skills to uncover opportunities that will enable Aritzia to create long lasting relationships with clients. And, with the skills you gain in this role, the opportunities are endless – from a rewarding career in Analytics to continued growth and development with Aritzia.




THE ROLE

As the Sr. Data Analyst, you will:

Partner and innovate with business leaders to deeply understand or identify the strategic opportunities across eCommerce, Retail, and other cross-functional divisions
Define measurement strategies to quantify the performance of various customer programs and compare their current condition against a hindsight benchmark
Support with generating actionable insights by analyzing customer behaviour, through diagnostics, correlations, and hypothesis testing to grow the business and enhance customer experience
Clearly and accurately visualize and communicate data and analytics through reports, dashboards, and presentations to maximize strategic decisions




THE QUALIFICATIONS

The Sr. Data Analyst has:

A commitment to learn and apply Aritzia's Business and People Leadership principles
An enthusiastic approach to taking on new opportunities and challenges
A commitment to navigating our internal operations to achieve the best team and business results
The ability to collaborate fluently with cross-functional partners.
The skills to set clear objectives with an emphasis on accountability while striving to reach your highest potential
Proven skills, education, and/or applicable certifications in:
SQL
Visualization tools (Tableau, Looker, Power BI)
Python
R or related statistical analysis tools
A commitment to quality and investing in results that add value to the business
A sense of urgency and ability to prioritize important work
An understanding and a passion for the industry in which we operate.




THE PERKS

Some of the industry-leading benefits you will receive working at Aritzia:

A-OK Commissary & Café - Our in-office, world-class bistro and café
The SET - Our in-house gym, with state-of-the art equipment and custom classes
Aspirational Workspace - Every detail is considered to connect to the energy of the culture
Dog Friendly Office - Bring your best friend to work
Amenities - Facilities include private parent's room, bike storage rooms, and shower facilities with complimentary conveniences
Product Discount - Our famous product discount, online and in store
Extras - A multitude of other perks like dry-cleaning, hotel and restaurant discounts, self-care promos, on-site medical care and more
Health & Safety - Industry-leading health and safety precautions, including on-site screenings, mask and distancing protocols, and cleaning supplies

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We're Hiring!

We're looking for brilliant thinkers to join our #Rocketeers. If you've ever wondered what it's like to work in a place where people enjoy their work and where talent is more important than the title, then keep reading.

What is ScalePad?

ScalePad is a market-leading software-as-a-service (SaaS) company with headquarters in Vancouver, Toronto, Montreal and Phoenix, AZ. However, we are proud to say our employee reach is now global so we can best serve our partners all over the world.

Our success is no accident: ScalePad provides MSPs of every size with the knowledge, technology, and community they need to deliver increased client value while navigating the continuously changing terrain of the IT landscape. With a suite of integrated products that automate and standardize MSP’s operations, analyze and uncover new opportunities, and expand value to clients, ScalePad is equipping the MSP adventure.

ScalePad has received awards such as MSP Today’s Product of the Year, G2’s 2024 Fastest Growing Product, and 2024 Best IT Management Product. In 2023, it was named a Best Workplace in Canada by Great Place to Work™. ScalePad is a privately held company serving over 12,000 MSPs across the globe.

You can contribute to our innovation and appreciate how your work is helping take this company to a higher level of operational maturity. More on that here.

Your mission should you choose to accept it.

As a Data Analyst, you will be a strategic partner to ScalePad’s Finance team, transforming complex data into clear, actionable insights. By refining internal processes and enhancing data-driven decision-making, you will help drive financial efficiency, scalability, and automation. Your work will ensure that leadership has the accurate, timely information needed to optimize performance, forecast with confidence, and support the company’s continued growth.

Responsibilities.


Design, develop, and maintain SQL-based data models to ensure efficient data transformation and reporting.
Build and optimize ETL pipelines within BI tools or deliver data through APIs.
Work closely with business stakeholders to understand requirements and translate them into scalable, maintainable analytics solutions.
Develop and manage dbt-based data transformations and Databricks workflows.
Build and enhance dashboards and reports in Tableau, ensuring data is accurate, accessible, and well-structured for analysis.
Collaborate with Data Engineers to improve data architecture, ensuring performance and scalability.
Utilize Python, R, SAS, or equivalent statistical tools for deeper data analysis, modeling, and automation.
Maintain data quality, governance, and documentation across all analytics solutions.


Qualifications.


5+ years of experience in analytics engineering, data analytics, or a related field.
Experience working in a SaaS environment is required.
Expert-level SQL skills with experience optimizing complex queries and data models.
Hands-on experience with ETL pipeline development within BI tools or using APIs.
Proficiency in dbt, Databricks, and Tableau.
Experience working with Python, R, SAS, or similar statistical analysis software.
Strong ability to engage with stakeholders, understand business needs, and develop analytical solutions that drive decision-making.
Experience working in a cloud-based data environment (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP) is a plus.
Excellent communication and problem-solving skills with a consultative approach.


What You’ll Love Working As A Rocketeer:


Everyone’s an Owner: Through our Employee Stock Option Plan (ESOP), each team member has a stake in our success. As we scale, your contributions directly shape our future – and you share in the rewards.
Growth, Longevity and Stability: Benefit from insights and training from our leadership and founder, whose extensive experience in funding and scaling successful software companies creates a stable environment for your long-term career growth. Their proven track record fosters a culture of lasting success.
Annual Training & Development: Every employee receives an annual budget for professional development, empowering you to advance your skills and career on your terms.
Hybrid Flexibility: Enjoy a world-class office at our headquarters in downtown Vancouver, Toronto, and Montreal and Arizona
Cutting-Edge Gear: Whether in the office or at home, you’ll be set up for success with top-of-the-line hardware.
Comprehensive Benefits: We’ve got you covered with an extensive benefits package with 100% medical and dental coverage fully employer-paid.
Flexible Time Off: With our unlimited flex-time policy in addition to all accrued vacation allows you to take the time you need to recharge and thrive.


Dream jobs don’t knock on your door every day.

ScalePad is not your typical software company. When we hire you, we aren’t just offering you a job, but rather we are committing to investing in both you and your long-term career. You'll help shape how this modern SaaS company operates and make a genuine impact on the future of our people, product, and partners.

We invite all qualified candidates to apply. Please note, you must be eligible to work in either Canada or the United States without requiring Visa sponsorship to be considered for this role. We thank you for your interest. However, only successful applicants will be contacted.

At ScalePad, we believe in the power of Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Belonging (DEIB) to drive innovation, collaboration, and success. We are committed to fostering a workplace where every individual's unique experiences and perspectives are valued, and where employees from all backgrounds can thrive. Our dedication to DEIB is woven into the fabric of our culture, guiding our actions and decisions as we build a stronger and more inclusive future together.

Join us and be part of a team that celebrates differences, embraces fairness, and ensures that everyone has an equal opportunity to contribute and grow. Together, we're creating an environment where diverse voices are not only heard but also amplified, where everyone feels valued, and where we can all achieve our full potential.

Please no recruiters or phone calls.
Show more
HTML:
We're Hiring!

We're looking for brilliant thinkers to join our #Rocketeers. If you've ever wondered what it's like to work in a place where people enjoy their work and where talent is more important than the title, then keep reading.

What is ScalePad?

ScalePad is a market-leading software-as-a-service (SaaS) company with headquarters in Vancouver, Toronto, Montreal and Phoenix, AZ. However, we are proud to say our employee reach is now global so we can best serve our partners all over the world.

Our success is no accident: ScalePad provides MSPs of every size with the knowledge, technology, and community they need to deliver increased client value while navigating the continuously changing terrain of the IT landscape. With a suite of integrated products that automate and standardize MSP’s operations, analyze and uncover new opportunities, and expand value to clients, ScalePad is equipping the MSP adventure.

ScalePad has received awards such as MSP Today’s Product of the Year, G2’s 2024 Fastest Growing Product, and 2024 Best IT Management Product. In 2023, it was named a Best Workplace in Canada by Great Place to Work™. ScalePad is a privately held company serving over 12,000 MSPs across the globe.

You can contribute to our innovation and appreciate how your work is helping take this company to a higher level of operational maturity. More on that here.

Your mission should you choose to accept it.

As a Data Analyst, you will be a strategic partner to ScalePad’s Finance team, transforming complex data into clear, actionable insights. By refining internal processes and enhancing data-driven decision-making, you will help drive financial efficiency, scalability, and automation. Your work will ensure that leadership has the accurate, timely information needed to optimize performance, forecast with confidence, and support the company’s continued growth.

Responsibilities.

  • Design, develop, and maintain SQL-based data models to ensure efficient data transformation and reporting.
  • Build and optimize ETL pipelines within BI tools or deliver data through APIs.
  • Work closely with business stakeholders to understand requirements and translate them into scalable, maintainable analytics solutions.
  • Develop and manage dbt-based data transformations and Databricks workflows.
  • Build and enhance dashboards and reports in Tableau, ensuring data is accurate, accessible, and well-structured for analysis.
  • Collaborate with Data Engineers to improve data architecture, ensuring performance and scalability.
  • Utilize Python, R, SAS, or equivalent statistical tools for deeper data analysis, modeling, and automation.
  • Maintain data quality, governance, and documentation across all analytics solutions.

Qualifications.

  • 5+ years of experience in analytics engineering, data analytics, or a related field.
  • Experience working in a SaaS environment is required.
  • Expert-level SQL skills with experience optimizing complex queries and data models.
  • Hands-on experience with ETL pipeline development within BI tools or using APIs.
  • Proficiency in dbt, Databricks, and Tableau.
  • Experience working with Python, R, SAS, or similar statistical analysis software.
  • Strong ability to engage with stakeholders, understand business needs, and develop analytical solutions that drive decision-making.
  • Experience working in a cloud-based data environment (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP) is a plus.
  • Excellent communication and problem-solving skills with a consultative approach.

What You’ll Love Working As A Rocketeer:

  • Everyone’s an Owner: Through our Employee Stock Option Plan (ESOP), each team member has a stake in our success. As we scale, your contributions directly shape our future – and you share in the rewards.
  • Growth, Longevity and Stability: Benefit from insights and training from our leadership and founder, whose extensive experience in funding and scaling successful software companies creates a stable environment for your long-term career growth. Their proven track record fosters a culture of lasting success.
  • Annual Training & Development: Every employee receives an annual budget for professional development, empowering you to advance your skills and career on your terms.
  • Hybrid Flexibility: Enjoy a world-class office at our headquarters in downtown Vancouver, Toronto, and Montreal and Arizona
  • Cutting-Edge Gear: Whether in the office or at home, you’ll be set up for success with top-of-the-line hardware.
  • Comprehensive Benefits: We’ve got you covered with an extensive benefits package with 100% medical and dental coverage fully employer-paid.
  • Flexible Time Off: With our unlimited flex-time policy in addition to all accrued vacation allows you to take the time you need to recharge and thrive.

Dream jobs don’t knock on your door every day.

ScalePad is not your typical software company. When we hire you, we aren’t just offering you a job, but rather we are committing to investing in both you and your long-term career. You'll help shape how this modern SaaS company operates and make a genuine impact on the future of our people, product, and partners.

We invite all qualified candidates to apply. Please note, you must be eligible to work in either Canada or the United States without requiring Visa sponsorship to be considered for this role. We thank you for your interest. However, only successful applicants will be contacted.

At ScalePad, we believe in the power of Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Belonging (DEIB) to drive innovation, collaboration, and success. We are committed to fostering a workplace where every individual's unique experiences and perspectives are valued, and where employees from all backgrounds can thrive. Our dedication to DEIB is woven into the fabric of our culture, guiding our actions and decisions as we build a stronger and more inclusive future together.

Join us and be part of a team that celebrates differences, embraces fairness, and ensures that everyone has an equal opportunity to contribute and grow. Together, we're creating an environment where diverse voices are not only heard but also amplified, where everyone feels valued, and where we can all achieve our full potential.

Please no recruiters or phone calls.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Are you ready to take your career to the next level with a leading company in the telecommunications industry? America Fujikura Limited (AFL) is on the hunt for dynamic, Junior Data Analystto join our Canadian Operations.

We are looking for a Junior Data Analystwith a strong computer science background to join our team. This role is ideal for a recent graduate or someone with up to 2 years of professional experience in software development. The ideal candidate will have a solid foundation in software engineering principles, object-oriented programming (OOP), and web development. While prior experience with Dynamics 365 or Power Platform is not required, an interest in learning business applications and cloud-based solutions is a plus.

Key Responsibilities


Software Development & Customization
Support the execution of solving business challenges using the Power Platform and O365.
Maintain and develop Power BI reports for the PMO.
Integrate data between internal and external systems (Customers)
Work on both front-end and back-end components of web applications.
Assist in developing and optimizing REST APIs and integrating applications.
Participate in the software development lifecycle, including requirements gathering, coding, testing, and deployment.


Data & System Integration


Work with relational databases such as SQL Server to manage and query data.
Assist in integrating different systems using APIs and cloud-based services.
Learn and implement Microsoft technologies such as Power Platform, Azure Functions, and Dataverse.


Testing & Quality Assurance


Support user acceptance testing (UAT) and troubleshoot issues.
Follow best practices for code quality, security, and performance.


Learning & Growth


Gain hands-on experience with Microsoft technologies, including Power Platform, Dynamics 365, and Azure.
Stay updated with emerging technologies and industry trends.
Participate in team discussions, technical workshops, and code reviews.


Qualifications

Education & Experience


Bachelor's degree in computer science, Software Engineering, or a related field.
0-2 years of experience in software development (internships, co-ops, or personal projects count!).


Technical Skills


Proficiency in at least one object-oriented programming language (C#, Java, or Python).
Strong understanding of data structures, algorithms, and database management.
Familiarity with SQL databases and writing efficient queries.
Understanding of cloud computing concepts (Azure, AWS, or Google Cloud is a plus).


Soft Skills


Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Willingness to learn and adapt to new technologies.
Good communication skills and ability to work in a team environment.
Detail-oriented and organized approach to coding and documentation.


Preferred (but Not Required) Skills


Exposure to Microsoft Power Platform (Power Apps, Power Automate, Dataverse).
Basic understanding of software development lifecycle (SDLC) and Agile methodologies.
Interest in business applications and enterprise software solutions.


We welcome diversity and encourage individuals of all backgrounds to apply!

We provide reasonable accommodations for individuals with disabilities. If you need accommodations during the application process, contact NSHRCanada@AFLglobal.com. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity, not discriminating based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability

Title: Western Canada Operations Data Analyst
Description:
Position Title: Western Canada Operations Data Analyst

Department: Operations Support

Reports To: Western Canada Manager, Operations Data

Direct Reports: None

Indirect Reports: None

Date: April 2025




Purpose of Position

The Western Canada Operations Data Analyst supports the development and maintenance of operational datasets and reporting tools that drive performance, consistency, and continuous improvement across collection and post-collection programs in Western Canada. This role transforms raw data into actionable insights to inform business decisions across the organization.




Key Responsibilities

Compliance, Metrics & Reporting

Design, build, and maintain Power BI dashboards and reports in collaboration with cross-functional teams, from requirement gathering to publication.
Maintain the “Master Dataset,” ensuring data connectivity, integrity, and accessibility.
Create custom DAX measures and use Power Query to enhance analytical outputs.
Compile and deliver operational scorecards and performance metrics.
Standardize collection and post-collection reporting across jurisdictions using consistent tools and methodologies.
Document and maintain operational procedures, business glossaries, and reporting standards to support end users.
Manage and archive reporting documents related to Recycle BC and SK Recycles programs.
Monitor and evaluate the performance of service providers and third-party partners, ensuring compliance with agreements.
Provide support on pilot projects and technology rollouts, offering guidance and reporting assistance.
Identify and mitigate data-related risks and ensure regulatory and contractual compliance.

Cross-Functional Collaboration & Technology Support

Act as a technical liaison for tools such as Power BI, CRM (C4C), AWS, SAP, and Microsoft Dynamics.
Support team members in utilizing these tools effectively.
Assist with planning and execution of operational projects, including pilots and new initiatives.
Maintain an integrated supply chain perspective linking collection, post-collection, supply, and audit activities.
Advocate for continuous improvement by identifying opportunities to streamline processes and reduce waste.
Support JIRA adoption within the team, including board setup, filters, and dashboards to improve project tracking and collaboration.
Work with IT and project leads to ensure accurate reflection of operational milestones in JIRA.
Ensure alignment and data integrity across the Recycle BC and SK Recycles ecosystems and SAP systems.




Interpersonal & Communication Responsibilities

Internal Collaboration:

Partner closely with the Western Canada Manager, Operations Data to identify data and reporting needs.
Collaborate with internal teams, including Recycle BC and SK Recycles staff, to ensure timely and accurate reporting.

External Collaboration:

Coordinate with external contractors and consultants on project deliverables.
Work cross-functionally with departments including Business Intelligence & Analytics, Data Visualization, Enterprise Knowledge, and Report Development.




Qualifications

Education:

Post-secondary education in IT, analytics, business operations, supply chain, or administration is an asset but not mandatory.

Experience:

Minimum of 2 years of experience in data analytics, with a strong focus on Excel and Power BI.
Experience in process improvement or operations is considered an asset.

Technical Skills:

Proficient in DAX, Power BI, Power Query, and Excel.
Familiarity with CRM systems (C4C), SAP (BW, S4HANA), AWS, and Microsoft Dynamics.
Basic knowledge of JIRA or similar project management tools.
Ability to automate reporting workflows and manage dashboard version control using tools like SharePoint or DevOps.

Soft Skills:

Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Clear communication and interpersonal skills to support collaboration across departments.
Excellent organizational and time-management skills.
Self-motivated and able to work independently.
A mindset focused on continuous improvement and operational excellence.

Working Conditions

Occasional travel within Western Canada may be required; a valid provincial driver’s license is necessary.
Extended hours may be needed during peak periods (e.g., quarterly reporting, business planning).
Must be comfortable working in a dynamic environment with frequent changes.




To apply, please submit your resume to this posting or email it directly to david.litherland@summitsearchgroup.com. Please note only qualified individuals will be contacted.




Summit Search Group is a fair and equitable search firm. We welcome and encourage applications from all candidates regardless of ethnicity, race, religious beliefs, disability, age, gender identity, or sexual orientation. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the recruitment and selection process.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
At Raymond James, we develop, we collaborate, we decide, we deliver, and we improve together .

Raymond James Ltd. is Canada’s leading independent investment dealers offering high quality investment products and services to Canadians seeking customized solutions to their wealth management needs.

Senior Data Analyst

How Does The Role Impact The Organization?

We are seeking an experienced Senior Data Analyst. Reporting to the Manager, Reporting and Analytics of the Enterprise Data team the Senior Data Analyst will be responsible for designing and building business intelligence and data integration solutions.

The Senior Data Analyst at Raymond James will help the organization to become more data driven by assisting the business in turning data into information, turning information into insight and insight into decisions. The analyst will conduct full lifecycle activities including requirements analysis, data analysis, data modeling, design, and development of data solutions.

What Will Your Role Be Responsible For?


Interpret business and data requirements after eliciting the problem that needs to be solved.
Design and implement scalable data and business intelligence solutions such as dashboards, reports, semantic models, extracts, and other data products that solve the business problem.
Collaborate with team members of the Enterprise Data team to identify data sources, relationships between data sources and build data pipelines that are required to solve the business requirements.
Coach and mentor other analysts on the team on best practices in data analysis and designing robust solutions.
Contribute to the overall enterprise data architecture, design, and process improvement.
Document requirements, solution design, process/data flows, data lineage and other technical specifications.
Create roadmaps for long term projects and data solutions.
Design solutions for analyzing large historical and multidimensional data.
Profile data sources using SQL and other data discovery tools in support of data quality analysis and business intelligence design efforts.
Perform other duties and responsibilities as assigned.


What Can You Expect From Us?

Our most important investment is in people. Upon eligibility, Raymond James Ltd offers flexible workstyles, a competitive compensation and benefits package. Our benefits range from Health Benefits, RRSP Matching Program, Employee Stock Purchase Plan, Paid Time Off, Volunteer Days, Discretionary Bonuses, Tuition Reimbursement and many more! We also support internal promotion and community involvement.

What Do We Expect From You?


Proficiency in understanding and creating data models, data profiling, data mapping, data mining and data segmentation techniques.
Proficiency in design and development of Power BI dashboards based on best practice design principles, data visualizations and efficient data models.
Excellent SQL skills with capability to write complex and efficient queries.
Capability to work with data from variety of sources and formats such as JSON via APIs, SQL, flat files etc.
Identify and understand issues, problems, and opportunities; analyze and compare data from different sources to identify patterns, issues and draw conclusions.
Advocate for improvements to processes, architecture, data quality, data governance, efficient design, and overall high standards in the team.
Strong verbal and written communication skills. Clearly convey information, insights, and ideas through a variety of media stakeholders in a manner that engages the audience and helps them understand and retain the message.
Collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate complex information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Make internal and external clients and their needs a primary focus of actions; understand business context, goals, develop and sustain productive client relationships.


Education and experience:


Diploma of Technology, bachelor’s degree in computer science, MIS, Business, or a related field preferred.
6+ years of experience in a business intelligence focused role leveraging Power BI, DAX and SQL.
2+ years of experience in cloud solutions such as Power BI service, Azure Synapse/Microsoft Fabric.
2+ years of experience working with API calls and JSON data to integrate with core data platforms or build dashboards/reports.
2+ years of experience in financial services industry preferably wealth management or investment banking sectors.
Demonstrated experience in using Python/R libraries for data analysis, data cleansing as well as production scale solutions.
Database/Data warehouse design and development experience is an asset.
Experience in an agile environment shipping products incrementally and iteratively.


We encourage our associates at all levels to:


Grow professionally and inspire others to do the same.
Work with and through others to achieve desired outcomes.
Make prompt, pragmatic choices and act with the client in mind.
Take ownership and hold themselves and others accountable for delivering results that matter.
Contribute to the continuous evolution of the firm.


At Raymond James – we honor, value, respect the uniqueness, experiences, and backgrounds of all of our Associates. When associates bring their best authentic self, our organization, clients and communities thrive, it is part of our part of our people-first culture. The Company is an equal opportunity employer and makes all employment decisions on the basis of merit and business needs.

Here at Raymond James we demonstrate our commitment to ensuring equal opportunities for all candidates. To request accommodations, candidates are instructed to contact Human Resources via email at recruitment@raymondjames.ca. By reaching out to this email address, candidates can communicate their specific requirements and discuss the necessary accommodations they may need to participate fully in the recruitment process.

Salary Range: BC (based on Education, Work Experience, etc) $105,000-115,000 in addition to competitive performance bonuses/incentives.

Primary Location

CA-BC-Burnaby-Burnaby

Other Locations

CA-ON-Toronto-Toronto

Organization

IT

Schedule

Full-time

Status

Permanent Full-Time

Title: Online Data Analyst
Description:
We are hiring freelance English and French speaking Online Data Analysts for a project aimed at improving the content and quality of digital maps, which are used by millions of users globally. The job would suit someone who is detail-oriented, likes doing research and has a good knowledge of national and local geography.

This is a freelance position on a flexible schedule - you can work in your own time whenever work is available. You will be completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment, e.g., verifying and comparing data, determining the relevance and accuracy of information. You will be provided with guidelines for each task, which need to be followed. The project offers a variety of tasks, and work is paid per task.

Requirements

Full Professional Proficiency in English and French
You must be living in Canada the last 2 consecutive years
Ability to follow guidelines and do research online using search engines, online maps and website information
You must have familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media and cultural affairs in Canada
Being open to work across a diverse set of Task Types (e.g. Maps, News, Audio tasks, Relevance)
Applicants must be 18 years or over.

Working on this project will require you to go through a standard recruitment process (including passing an open book assessment). This is a long-term project and your work will occasionally be subject to quality assurance checks.

Better work-life balance
Be your own boss

Title: Data Analytics Associate
Description:
About Us

RB Global (NYSE: RBA) (TSX: RBA) is a leading, omnichannel marketplace that provides value-added insights, services and transaction solutions for buyers and sellers of commercial assets and vehicles worldwide. Through its auction sites in 13 countries and digital platform, RB Global serves customers in more than 170 countries across a variety of asset classes, including automotive, commercial transportation, construction, government surplus, lifting and material handling, energy, mining and agriculture.

The company’s marketplace brands include Ritchie Bros., the world’s largest auctioneer of commercial assets and vehicles offering online bidding, and IAA, a leading global digital marketplace connecting vehicle buyers and sellers. RB Global’s portfolio of brands also includes Rouse Services, which provides a complete end-to-end asset management, data-driven intelligence and performance benchmarking system; SmartEquip, an innovative technology platform that supports customers’ management of the equipment lifecycle and integrates parts procurement with both OEMs and dealers; Xcira, a leader in live simulcast auction technologies; and Veritread, an online marketplace for heavy haul transport.

About The Team

Ritchie Bros. Financial Services is our dynamic, fast-paced and passionate equipment financing business unit. Outgoing, entrepreneurial, collaborative, fun, energetic, resilient, competitive, friendly, customer-focused – we like our coworkers and our adjectives. Our ultimate reward is successfully helping our coworkers achieve and develop within our organization.

Job Description

The Data Analytics Associate serves as a support partner to various department groups and leaders within Ritchie Bros. Financial Services. They provide objective and fact-based analytical reviews to deliver quantitative insights of past performance drivers (descriptive), forecasting of current and future opportunities (predictive), and opportunities to drive positive change (prescriptive). The data analyst will also be responsible for supporting a suite of business intelligence reports to ensure that performance metrics are transparent and accessible.

Responsibilities
Independently execute complex data analysis - structuring analysis, executing analysis, synthesizing results, presenting results. Act as an analytics partner for different department units and functional teams within the organization
Lead / take ownership of data related products - e.g., building report dashboards to support the business and teams
Translate business questions into specific requirements and then deliver meaningful insights through a combination of expert technical skill and deep understanding of the business problem
Execute analysis of the company’s customer and business data, including predictive modeling, forecasting and statistical analysis
Proactively identify solutions for improving the effectiveness of business activities within sales, credit, and funding operations
Routine reporting - Support regular monthly business reporting requirements
Presentation of analysis - convene groups & teams to collaborate on issue or questions
Perform other duties as assigned.

Qualifications
A Bachelor's Degree in Business, Economics, Mathematics, or Statistics
Strong understanding of data analysis including collection, exploration, modeling, interpretation, and communication
Previous experience in creating data visualizations of insights and “self-serve” dashboards / reporting tools
Additional experience in Tableau, Salesforce, KNIME, R, etc. is considered an asset.
Show more

Title: Senior Analyst - NHL
Description:
Description & Requirements

Electronic Arts creates next-level entertainment experiences that inspire players and fans around the world. Here, everyone is part of the story. Part of a community that connects across the globe. A place where creativity thrives, new perspectives are invited, and ideas matter. A team where everyone makes play happen.

We evolve our games and how players interact with them by using the power of data to continuously uncover insights to deliver an even better player experience. We strive to be the best-in-class AI team in the gaming industry by maximizing the fun for EA players through easier deployment of AI-driven solutions for game makers. Our insights are ubiquitous through autonomous analytics.

You will be a member of our Sports Analytics team and empower the NHL game team with data-driven insights, tools, and recommendations to make more data informed decisions, driving value for our business and players. This is a hybrid role located in Vancouver, B.C. and will report to the Director of Analytics of NHL and UFC.

Responsibilities


You will collaborate with your team to understand requirements and scope deliverables
You will guide the game team in being hypothesis focused, and data driven
You will deliver end to end analytics projects and present insights
You will develop a suite of dashboards to promote self-service data access
You will contribute to the aggregate layer of data to support efficient analysis
You will design game telemetry that meets analysis requirements


Qualifications


A degree in a quantitative discipline (Analytics, Data Science, Business, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics)
3+ years of experience in an analytics role performing quantitative analysis
1+ years of experience independently managing projects and building analysis plans
Expertise in SQL and ability to extract data from large data sources
Experience in statistical modeling with Python or R (e.g. regression, clustering)
Data visualization experience (e.g. Tableau, Power BI)


Compensation And Benefits

The ranges listed below are what EA in good faith expects to pay applicants for this role in these locations at the time of this posting. If you reside in a different location, a recruiter will advise on the applicable range and benefits. Pay offered will be determined based on a number of relevant business and candidate factors (e.g. education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, geographic location, or business needs).

PAY RANGES


British Columbia (depending on location e.g. Vancouver vs. Victoria) * $89,300 - $123,000 CAD


In British Columbia, we offer a package of benefits including vacation (3 weeks per year to start), 10 days per year of sick time, paid top-up to EI/QPIP benefits up to 100% of base salary when you welcome a new child (12 weeks for maternity, and 4 weeks for parental/adoption leave), extended health/dental/vision coverage, life insurance, disability insurance, retirement plan to regular full-time employees. Certain roles may also be eligible for bonus and equity.

About Electronic Arts

We’re proud to have an extensive portfolio of games and experiences, locations around the world, and opportunities across EA. We value adaptability, resilience, creativity, and curiosity. From leadership that brings out your potential, to creating space for learning and experimenting, we empower you to do great work and pursue opportunities for growth.

We take a holistic approach with our benefits program, focusing on physical, emotional, financial, career, and community wellness to support a balanced life with paid time off and new parent leave, plus free games and so much more. We nurture environments where our teams can always bring their best to what they do.

Electronic Arts is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We will also consider employment qualified applicants with criminal records in accordance with applicable law. EA also makes workplace accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities as required by applicable law.

Title: Digital Analyst
Description:
Overview:

At Saje Natural Wellness, we're nature's original farmacy, blending the superpower of plants so you can remedy real life, naturally. And like nature, we're continually growing! As we continue to build our team, we're seeking talented people to join us: in our stores, support offices, and distribution centres. We are a purpose-driven, people-first organization where collaboration, innovation and entrepreneurial mindsets thrive.

We look for individuals who have drive and warmth, agility and passion, and keep customer experience at the centre of everything they do.

At Saje, you’ll connect with a dynamic community and make a positive impact. Join our team and grow your career, alongside the most talented, hard working, and kind-hearted people out there.

The impact you'll make:

Reporting into our Sr. Director, Growth, as a Digital Analyst, you will have a unique opportunity to contribute to our digital strategy by gathering, analyzing, and reporting on key data across multiple channels. You’ll collaborate with multiple key stakeholders across the growth, ecommerce, marketing teams, ensuring that your findings lead to actionable insights for both immediate optimizations and long-term strategy.

All Saje Team Members are responsible for contributing to Saje’s culture and maintaining a positive environment for themselves and their peers.

What you'll do:


Reporting & Analysis: Own the creation and maintenance of regular reports that track performance across key digital channels (web, social, email, paid media, etc.). Present findings to stakeholders, offering actionable insights to optimize current campaigns, improve performance, and guide decision-making.
Proactive Insights & Recommendations: Provide proactive, data-driven recommendations based on performance trends, helping the team make improvements before performance issues arise. This includes identifying optimization opportunities in user journeys, conversion rates, and campaign targeting.
Reactive Problem Solving: Respond to urgent performance issues by diving deep into data to identify root causes. Provide timely solutions or adjustments based on immediate needs, including troubleshooting traffic drops, underperforming campaigns, or customer behavior changes.
Cross-functional Collaboration: Work closely with stakeholders across growth, ecommerce, & marketing to understand objectives and share insights that inform strategy. Act as a trusted advisor, translating data into actionable steps for optimization.
Dashboard Creation & Maintenance: Develop, maintain, and evolve customized dashboards and visualizations to deliver key insights and KPIs across the organization. Use platforms like Looker Studio & Power BI to provide real-time visibility into digital performance.
Website Tagging & GA4 Management: Audit, implement and maintain all website tagging and GA4 setup.
Testing & Experimentation: Manage A/B tests and other experiments, focusing on performance optimization. Help design and implement experiments, monitor and analyze results, and suggest adjustments to improve user experience and campaign outcomes.
Customer & Market Behavior Analysis: Use analytics tools to assess consumer behavior and identify trends that inform not only marketing but product and business strategy. Provide insights into customer acquisition, engagement, retention, and churn.
Data Integrity & Accuracy: Ensure the accuracy and integrity of all data used for analysis. Maintain a keen eye for detail to validate data inputs and outcomes, ensuring all insights are based on reliable information.



We'd love to hear from you if you have:


Proficiency in Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, and other analytics tools.
Experience working with multiple product SKUs, within a D2C organization.
Proven ability to produce detailed, actionable reports and dashboards for various stakeholders.
Experience with A/B testing and optimizing digital campaigns based on data.
Advanced Excel/Google Sheets skills (pivot tables, formulas, etc.) and experience with data visualization tools like Looker Studio & Power BI.
Strong problem-solving skills with a proactive approach to identifying opportunities and addressing issues.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to translate complex data findings into clear recommendations.
Strong attention to detail and the ability to work with large datasets.
Experience with marketing automation platforms, CRM & CDP is an added bonus.
Google Analytics certification or other relevant analytics certifications is an added bonus.
Knowledge of SQL, R, Python and/or other programming languages is an added bonus.



Why Saje?

Here at Saje, we understand that joining a team is an important decision to make, so we want to be sure you're supported to do your best work.

The compensation range for this position is from $80,000- 92,500 annually. Base pay is dependent to market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, experience, and internal equity. Other components of our total rewards offerings include:  


Bonus Program
A hybrid way of working
Flexible work hours based on business needs
Wellness days to ensure you're taking care of you mental and physical health
Health benefits - comprehensive health, vision and dental packages
Paid sick days
Generous product discount
Full onboarding plan and onboarding buddy to help you settle in
Employee Assistance Program - 24/7 support, resources, and information available to you and your family
Paid time off to ensure you're resting & recharging
Product training to help you learn about the benefits and efficacy of our 100% natural products to support your own wellness journey



Note: The incentive programs, benefits, and perks have certain eligibility requirements. The company reserves the right to alter these incentive programs, benefits, and perks in whole or in part at any time without advance notice.

Join our team!

If this opportunity sounds like you, please apply in the link below. Not sure you're 100% the right fit? We encourage you to apply even if you don't have all of the listed qualifications. We offer a thorough onboarding experience to set you up for success, learning and development support, and help you to integrate seamlessly.

Saje provides equal employment opportunity to all employees and applicants and believe the best teams are made up of diverse perspectives and people. We offer reasonable accommodations to candidates with disabilities throughout the recruitment process and will work with you to ensure you are supported while working at Saje.
Show more

  • Dashboard Creation & Maintenance: Develop, maintain, and evolve customized dashboards and visualizations to deliver key insights and KPIs across the organization. Use platforms like Looker Studio & Power BI to provide real-time visibility into digital performance.
  • Website Tagging & GA4 Management: Audit, implement and maintain all website tagging and GA4 setup.
  • Testing & Experimentation: Manage A/B tests and other experiments, focusing on performance optimization. Help design and implement experiments, monitor and analyze results, and suggest adjustments to improve user experience and campaign outcomes.
  • Customer & Market Behavior Analysis: Use analytics tools to assess consumer behavior and identify trends that inform not only marketing but product and business strategy. Provide insights into customer acquisition, engagement, retention, and churn.
  • Data Integrity & Accuracy: Ensure the accuracy and integrity of all data used for analysis. Maintain a keen eye for detail to validate data inputs and outcomes, ensuring all insights are based on reliable information.


We'd love to hear from you if you have:

  • Proficiency in Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, and other analytics tools.
  • Experience working with multiple product SKUs, within a D2C organization.
  • Proven ability to produce detailed, actionable reports and dashboards for various stakeholders.
  • Experience with A/B testing and optimizing digital campaigns based on data.
  • Advanced Excel/Google Sheets skills (pivot tables, formulas, etc.) and experience with data visualization tools like Looker Studio & Power BI.
  • Strong problem-solving skills with a proactive approach to identifying opportunities and addressing issues.
  • Excellent communication skills with the ability to translate complex data findings into clear recommendations.
  • Strong attention to detail and the ability to work with large datasets.
  • Experience with marketing automation platforms, CRM & CDP is an added bonus.
  • Google Analytics certification or other relevant analytics certifications is an added bonus.
  • Knowledge of SQL, R, Python and/or other programming languages is an added bonus.


Why Saje?

Here at Saje, we understand that joining a team is an important decision to make, so we want to be sure you're supported to do your best work.

The compensation range for this position is from $80,000- 92,500 annually. Base pay is dependent to market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, experience, and internal equity. Other components of our total rewards offerings include:  

  • Bonus Program
  • A hybrid way of working
  • Flexible work hours based on business needs
  • Wellness days to ensure you're taking care of you mental and physical health
  • Health benefits - comprehensive health, vision and dental packages
  • Paid sick days
  • Generous product discount
  • Full onboarding plan and onboarding buddy to help you settle in
  • Employee Assistance Program - 24/7 support, resources, and information available to you and your family
  • Paid time off to ensure you're resting & recharging
  • Product training to help you learn about the benefits and efficacy of our 100% natural products to support your own wellness journey


Note: The incentive programs, benefits, and perks have certain eligibility requirements. The company reserves the right to alter these incentive programs, benefits, and perks in whole or in part at any time without advance notice.

Join our team!

If this opportunity sounds like you, please apply in the link below. Not sure you're 100% the right fit? We encourage you to apply even if you don't have all of the listed qualifications. We offer a thorough onboarding experience to set you up for success, learning and development support, and help you to integrate seamlessly.

Saje provides equal employment opportunity to all employees and applicants and believe the best teams are made up of diverse perspectives and people. We offer reasonable accommodations to candidates with disabilities throughout the recruitment process and will work with you to ensure you are supported while working at Saje.

Title: Growth Data Analyst
Description:
About Dutch

Dutch is on a mission to make veterinary care more accessible and affordable for pet parents across the country. As the leading virtual care provider able to diagnose, prescribe, and deliver treatment all from home, we’re helping pets live happier, healthier lives — and giving their humans peace of mind.




We’re a small, data-driven team that thrives on solving complex problems, testing ideas quickly, and using insights to drive real results. If you’re excited to work at the intersection of marketing, experimentation, and analytics — and care about making a meaningful impact for pets and their people — we’d love to meet you.




About the Role

We’re looking for a Growth Data Analyst to help us optimize how we acquire, convert, and retain customers. In this role, you'll work cross-functionally with marketing, product, and lifecycle teams to measure performance, run experiments, and uncover insights that fuel smarter growth strategies.




You’ll own reporting for marketing performance, lead analysis in tools like Amplitude, and support testing initiatives across the funnel — from paid acquisition to onboarding and retention.




Location: Remote — must be based in Canada and able to work core hours aligned with the Pacific Time Zone (PT)




Key Responsibilities

Build and maintain dashboards that track key growth metrics across paid and owned channels
Analyze marketing performance (Google, Facebook, Lifecycle, etc.) and provide actionable insights to improve CAC, ROAS, and funnel efficiency
Lead A/B test tracking and analysis in Amplitude — from experiment design support to post-test readouts that measures incrementality and potential business impact
Collaborate with marketing and lifecycle teams to identify high-leverage opportunities for optimization
Partner with product teams to attribute marketing performance to user behavior and retention
Identify and define key user segments to personalize campaigns and improve targeting strategies




Qualifications

4+ years experience in a growth, marketing, or product analytics role
Strong experience in tools like Segment and Amplitude to track user behavior, optimize funnels, and run experiments
Proficiency in SQL and at least one BI tool (Sigma, Tableau, Looker, etc.)
Familiarity with performance marketing platforms (Google Ads, Facebook/Meta)
Experience analyzing performance from emerging or non-traditional channels (e.g., TikTok, TV ads, influencers)
Familiarity with marketing automation tools (Iterable, Klaviyo)
Strong communication skills — you can turn complex data into clear, actionable insights
Comfortable in a fast-paced, collaborative startup environment




Bonus Points If You Have

Experience working at a startup ecommerce company
Familiarity with lifecycle marketing and retention analysis
A love of pets and a passion for mission-driven work

Show more

Title: Senior Finance Data Analyst
Description:
Company Overview

At Motorola Solutions, we believe that everything starts with our people. We’re a global close-knit community, united by the relentless pursuit to help keep people safer everywhere. Our critical communications, video security and command center technologies support public safety agencies and enterprises alike, enabling the coordination that’s critical for safer communities, safer schools, safer hospitals and safer businesses. Connect with a career that matters, and help us build a safer future.

Aperçu de l’entreprise

Chez Motorola Solutions, nous pensons que tout commence par nos employés. Nous sommes une communauté mondiale soudée, unie par la volonté incessante de contribuer à la sécurité des personnes partout dans le monde. Nos technologies de communication, de sécurité vidéo et de centre de commandement essentielles soutiennent les agences de sécurité publique et les entreprises, permettant une coordination essentielle pour des communautés, des écoles, des hôpitaux et des entreprises plus sécuritaires. Connectez-vous à une carrière qui compte et aidez-nous à bâtir un avenir plus sûr.

Department Overview

Motorola Solutions ﬁxed and mobile video, access control and software solutions, led by our Avigilon Alta, Avigilon Unity, Pelco & Envysion portfolios help you ﬁnd, analyze and share information so you can respond to events with speed and decisiveness to keep your people and property safe. Whether you are looking to deploy a new video security or access control solution, equip your team with body-worn cameras, or leverage analytics through purpose-built applications, we have solutions to meet your needs.

Job Description

Position Overview

This role involves leveraging data analytics to drive financial reporting, process automation, and strategic decision-making. A successful candidate will bridge technical data expertise with financial acumen, ensuring accurate reporting, system optimization, and proactive problem-solving within the finance function. The candidate will own data workflows from collection to visualization, demonstrating technical knowledge and strategic problem-solving capabilities.

Key Responsibilities


Oversee the preparation and delivery of financial reports for monthly/quarterly cycles, ensuring alignment with regulatory and organizational standards
Design, maintain, and optimize Power BI and Tableau dashboards for real-time financial performance tracking and stakeholder communication
Automate repetitive financial workflows (e.g., data collection, report generation) using Python, SQL, or low-code platforms like Power Automate
Act as the AI subject matter expert for the company by advising on ways to implement throughout the business
Proactively identify data discrepancies, system inefficiencies, or reporting gaps and implement corrective measures
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to translate financial data into actionable business insights
Develop predictive models to forecast financial trends and assess risk scenarios


Qualifications


Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Data Science, Economics, Statistics, or related field
5+ years’ experience in financial data analysis


Technical qualifications:


Expert-level Power BI/Power Query development
Production-grade Python/SQL scripting (Pandas, NumPy, etc.)
Data modeling and warehouse architecture principles


Demonstrated ability to:


Simplify complex financial data for non-technical audiences
Troubleshoot system errors and implement technical solutions independently
Manage multiple priorities in deadline-driven environment
Knowledge of advanced analytics techniques for automation and process improvement
Background in developing self-service reporting tools for business teams


Differentiating Skills


Experience implementing machine learning workflows (predictive modeling, pattern recognition)
Knowledge of cloud analytics platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure)
Experience incorporating AI strategies in reporting and business processes
Background in developing API integrations or data governance frameworks


Target Base Salary Range: $59,600 - $105,500 CAD

Consistent with Motorola Solutions values and applicable law, we provide the following information to promote pay transparency and equity. Pay within this range varies and depends on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. The actual offer will be based on the individual candidate.

Basic Requirements


Bachelor’s Degree with 5+ years’ experience in financial data analysis


Travel Requirements

Under 10%

Relocation Provided

None

Position Type

Experienced

Referral Payment Plan

No

EEO Statement

Motorola Solutions is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally-protected characteristic.

We are proud of our people-first and community-focused culture, empowering every Motorolan to be their most authentic self and to do their best work to deliver on the promise of a safer world. If you’d like to join our team but feel that you don’t quite meet all of the preferred skills, we’d still love to hear why you think you’d be a great addition to our team.

We’re committed to providing an inclusive and accessible recruiting experience for candidates with disabilities, or other physical or mental health conditions. To request an accommodation, please email ohr@motorolasolutions.com.

Motorola Solutions adopte, favorise et promeut les principes de diversité, d’équité et d’inclusion. Nous encourageons et accueillons les candidatures de toutes les personnes qualifiées, quelles que soient leur race, origines ethnique, religion ou croyance, orientation sexuelle, identité et expression sexuelle, statut d’anciens combattants ou tout autre statut protégé par la Loi.

Nous sommes fiers de notre culture axée sur les personnes et les communautés, encourageant ainsi chaque Motorolan d’être la version la plus authentique de lui-même dans ses responsabilités afin de tenir la promesse d’un monde plus sécuritaire.

Si vous souhaitez vous joindre à notre communauté mais croyez que vous ne possédez pas toutes les exigences requises pour le poste convoité, nous aimerions tout de même connaître les raisons pour lesquelles vous pensez être un excellent candidat pour notre équipe.

Nous offrons également des mesures d’adaptation pendant toutes les étapes du processus d’embauche afin de favoriser l’inclusion des personnes vivant avec un handicap physique et/ou mental. Si vous avez besoin de mesures d’adaptation, svp nous faire parvenir un courriel à ohr@motorolasolutions.com.

Title: Senior Data Analyst - Fraud
Description:
Job Description

Remitly's vision is to transform lives with trusted financial services that transcend borders. Since 2011, we have been tirelessly delivering on our promises to people who send money around the world. Today, we are reimagining global financial services and building products that extend beyond traditional barriers to give customers access to more of the services they need, no matter where they call home. Join over 2,700 employees worldwide who are growing their careers with purpose and connection with our customers while having a positive impact on millions of people around the globe.

About The Role

Remitly is looking for a Senior Data Analyst to join the Small and Micro Business team, with a focus on fraud detection, risk analysis, and compliance support. This is a unique opportunity to work on a new product line from the ground up, where your analytical insights will directly help shape how we prevent fraud and maintain trust at scale.

As a Senior Data Analyst, you will work with product managers, risk teams, data scientists, and engineers to analyze fraud patterns, build dashboards, develop monitoring tools, and inform strategic decisions. You'll help lay the foundation for how we use data to detect fraud and mitigate risk, ensuring the integrity of our business payments platform as it scales globally. This role is ideal for someone who enjoys solving complex problems with data and has a strong business sense. Your work will directly impact customer experience and business performance. This role is hybrid and based in Vancouver, BC, Canada.

You Will


Become an expert on Remitly's Payments Fraud (Scams, Chargebacks, Promo Abuse) data, experience, policy, and regulatory requirements
Analyze customer behavior and transactional data to detect patterns indicative of fraud.
Build and maintain dashboards and reporting tools that track fraud trends and key risk metrics and deliver actionable insights.
Develop, test, and deploy fraud rules in collaboration with program, operations and engineering teams to reduce fraudulent activity.
Partner with data scientists and engineers to refine and operationalize fraud detection models.
Collaborate with product, risk, compliance, and engineering teams to influence roadmap and priorities with data-driven recommendations.
Design and run experiments (e.g., A/B tests) to evaluate the effectiveness of fraud controls and mitigation strategies.


You Have


5+ years of experience in product analytics, fraud/risk analytics, or data analysis roles.
Expert in SQL and proficient in tools like Python or R for data analysis.
Experience with fraud detection strategies, risk scoring, and related metrics.
Experience with data visualisation tools like Tableau or similar.
Clear communicator with a knack for simplifying complex data insights for business stakeholders.
Bachelor's or advanced degree in a quantitative field (Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, etc.).


Compensation Details. The starting base salary range for this position is $120,000 to $150,000. In Canada, Remitly employees are shareholders in our Company and equity is part of our total compensation plan. Your recruiter can share more information about medical benefits offered, as well as other financial benefits and total compensation components offered with this role.

Our Benefits


Three weeks vacation
Health Benefits
Mental Health & Family Forming Benefits
Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP)
Life Insurance & Disability
Continuing education and travel benefits


We are committed to nondiscrimination across our global organization and in all of our business operations. Employment is determined based upon personal capabilities and qualifications without discrimination on the basis of race, creed, color, religion, sex, gender identification and expression, marital status, military status or status as an honorably discharge/veteran, pregnancy (including a woman's potential to get pregnant, pregnancy-related conditions, and childbearing), sexual orientation, age (40 and over), national origin, ancestry, citizenship or immigration status, physical, mental, or sensory disability (including the use of a trained dog guide or service animal), HIV/AIDS or hepatitis C status, genetic information, status as an actual or perceived victim of domestic violence, sexual assault, or stalking, or any other protected class as established by law.

Remitly is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.
